column2: Wake up in cryo facility
column3: 在冷冻设施中醒来

column2:
You wake up disoriented, slumped over the base of an empty cryosleep pod, still damp from cryo fluid. The thick dust from the floor clings to your skin, leaving a clean spot on the ground, where a large "05" is painted.

Across the room, there is an open door to the hallway, and a broken window leading outside.

Just as you gather your wits, an unearthly scream erupts from down the hall beyond the doorway. Something is coming. Fast.
column3: 你从昏厥中苏醒，蜷缩在一个空荡荡的冷冻睡眠舱内，里面的冷冻液还没干，地板上厚厚的灰尘粘在你的皮肤上。地面上一处干净的地方，上面涂有一个大大的 "05" 字样。在房间的另一边，有一扇通往走廊的开门，还有一扇通向外面的破窗。就在你收拾心情的时候，一声不祥的尖叫从大厅的深处传来。有什么东西马上就要来了！利用你的所有能力想想该怎么做？快！

column2: DMC Gates
column3: 底特律大门

column2:
Navigating the twisty maze of shacks and tarp shelters, Detroit's massive walls stand as a constant backdrop to the east.

Easily half a dozen stories high, and probably almost as thick, the city walls are an impressive sight to behold. Armed towers, bristling with surveillance arrays, stand at regular intervals, keeping watch over the Sprawl, and likely the city within.

Before you, giant vidscreens on the three gatehouses flash instructions about pass requirements and threat levels, as flocks of people stream into and out of the gates.

You take your place in line on the right, with the others entering the city.
column3: 你穿行在拥挤杂乱的被棚屋油布帐篷构造成迷宫的延伸区中,底特律的高墙就像东边的一面巨大的幕布。城墙无疑有数十米那么高，甚至也有可能数十米那么厚，十分令人印象深刻。密密麻麻的监视阵列与全副武装的哨塔不停地扫描着出入口，监视着这围墙的内外。在你面前，三个报关所上的巨型录像屏幕不停地闪烁着关于通行证要求和威胁级别的指令，进出城的人群像流水线一般。你站在右边排队，与其他人一起进入城市。

column2: First Visit to the House at Seven Gables Road
column3: 第一次去七山墙路的房子

column2:
As you make your way down old Seven Gables Road, you feel a growing sense of unease. There's an unnatural silence here, except for the whispering of air moving through branches bare of all but a few dead leaves. Your footsteps are impossibly loud on the waterlogged bed of reeds and leaves, announcing your presence.

Ahead, you can see the silhouette of the house: dark, lonely, and in disrepair. The old split-level looks like it may have been a home for a family once, judging by the rusty swingset.
column3: 当你沿着老七山墙路前行时，你会感到越来越不安。这里有一种不自然的寂静，除了空气穿过除了几片枯叶之外什么都没有的树枝的低语。你的脚步声在芦苇和树叶的积水床上大得不可思议，宣告着你的存在。在前方，你可以看到房子的轮廓：黑暗、孤独、年久失修。从生锈的秋千来看，旧的错层看起来可能曾经是一个家庭的家。

column2: Entering Detroit Mega City
column3: 进入底特律大都市

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAA10816 Authorized."

The guard takes you into a small room with a table in the middle. They confiscate weapons and other specific items not allowed in the city, and then give them back.

"Alright, buddy, put your things on the table," the guard instructs and you comply. The guard then ushers you forward, and you begin down a long-ish stretch of empty corridor lined with harsh xenon lighting.

Beyond the opening at the other end, you see throngs of activity and the flicker of busy signage eclipsed by passing people.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。一阵啁啾声打破了意味深长的沉默, 同时显示屏开始刷新。"访客通行证 N6MAA10816 已授权。"警卫带你进入一个中间有一张桌子的小房间。他们没收武器和其他不允许带进城中的特定物品，之后再物归原主。"好吧，伙计，把你的东西放在桌子上," 警卫指示你，你遵从了。警卫随后把你领到最前面，你开始沿着一条带有强烈的氙灯照明的空走廊行走。在另一端的入口之外，你看到了人山人海和闪烁的招牌，这些都被不断经过的人群遮挡住了。

column2: Give Hatter the urn.
column3: 把骨灰盒交给哈特

column2:
"It hardly seems worth the fuss," Hatter says as you hand him the urn. "I'd almost forgo my end of the payment to know the story behind it."

He places the urn in a safe, then locks it. "But it's not worth the hit to my reputation." He reaches into a desk drawer, and produces a black wristband. "As agreed, your visitor's pass."

"I will now message my contact so they add you to the system. We already have images of your face from the security cameras so that's one thing ready. That way your file actually appears when the guards scan your pass," Hatter says as he starts typing on his device.

As you ride the elevator car down through the building's innards once again, you wonder what to expect beyond DMC's massive gates.
column3: "这几乎不值得如此大动干戈，" 哈特说道，当你把骨灰瓶递给他时。"我几乎愿意放弃我的那部分报酬，只为知道它背后的故事。"他把骨灰瓶放进一个保险柜里，然后锁上了。"但这不值得使我声誉受损。"他从办公桌抽屉里拿出一个黑色手环。"如约，你的访客通行证。" "我现在会联系我的联系人，让他们把你添加到系统中。我们已经从监控摄像头中获取了你的面部图像，所以这方面已经准备好了。这样当保安扫描你的通行证时，你的档案就会出现，" 哈特说着，开始在设备上打字。当你再次乘坐电梯穿过大楼内部时，你不禁想象在 DMC 巨大的大门之外会有什么等着你。

column2: Denied Entry - No Pass
column3: 拒绝进入 - 无通行证

column2:
When you reach the front of the line, a sinking feeling overcomes you. Heavily armed guards in full combat armor are checking attendees with some sort of scanning device. You're pretty sure that whatever these other folks have to get in, you're missing it.

When it's your turn, the guard stops you, and turns to a monitor installed in the wall. A message reads "Device not detected. Entrance denied."

With the efficiency and compassion of an assembly line worker, he directs you away from the line, back outside. Unfortunately, getting entrance to the city may be trickier than just showing up.
column3: 当你排到队伍的最前面时，一种沮丧的感觉袭上心头。身穿全副武装的警卫正在使用某种扫描设备检查进城者。你很确定，不管其他人必须要携带的东西是什么，你都没有。当轮到你的时候，警卫让你停下，并转向墙上安装的监视器。一条信息写道 "未检测到设备，拒绝进入。"拒绝进入。”他以流水线工人的效率和同情心引导着你离开人群，回到外面。不幸的是，要进入这个城市可能比仅仅出现在这里更加棘手。

column2: DMC Questioning
column3: 底特律问询

column2:
Inside, under pale lighting, you're made to wait in restraints for hours. Drab cubicles divide most of the floor, and stern-looking operatives variously interview detainees, check computers, and disappear into other cubicles.

Your eyes mine every detail of the room, looking for anything interesting to settle on. White foam ceiling tiles, beige filing cabinets, black inbox/outbox trays, pine desktops...it's so sterile that it actually incites frustration.

Helpfully, informational posters and propaganda seem to be hung on display to add a splash of color. "DMC Perimeter Services: We Care!" and "Contraband: It hurts all of us."

The "Missing Persons" touchscreen was good for about an hour, but you've memorized all the faces by now.
column3: 询问室内，在苍白的灯光下，你不得不在限制中等待数小时。这里都是一个个单调的隔间,神情严肃的特工进行各种细节询问、电脑录入，最后又去了其他隔间。你仔仔细细地观察房间，想找点有趣的东西。白色泡沫天花板，米色文件柜，黑色的收件箱/发件箱托盘，松木桌面......它是如此无趣，以至于它实际上会引发沮丧感。令人欣慰的是， 信息海报和宣传品似乎被悬挂起来，以增加一抹色彩。底特律周边服务:交给我们!"和 "走私:害人害己" 那 "寻人启事" 的触屏让你排遣了一小时时光，但你现在已经把他们的脸全记住了。

column2: Exiled from DMC
column3: 被底特律流放

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-Fraud and misuse of visas
-Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的哔哔声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。"你被指控以下罪名： -欺诈和滥用签证 -密谋欺诈底特律市 -未披露个人信息"

column2: Denied Entry - Criminal Pass
column3: 拒绝进入 - 伪造的通行证

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAC41717 Flagged: Detain for Questioning."

Your gut suddenly feels like a vacuum. The guard places a heavy-gloved hand on your shoulder. "Alright, buddy, let's go."

You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。一阵啁啾声打破了意味深长的沉默, 同时显示屏开始刷新。"访客通行证 N6MAC41717 被标记：拘留审问。"你的内脏突然感觉像真空一样。警卫用重重的手套抓住你的肩膀。"好吧，伙计，走吧。"你被带到据点南部扶壁下的一扇灰色门前，旁边是一扇窄面窗户。

column2: DMC Questioning - Basic, forged pass
column3: 底特律问询

column2:
By the time your case handler arrives, you've counted the ceiling tiles, grouped them into shades of beige, and created an elaborate conspiracy linking all the missing persons.

Your handler leads you to his cubicle, and you're subjected to a battery of tests, including face scan, retinal scan, DNA sampling, fingerprinting, and a blood sample.

The interview is something of a comedy, with questions like "What is your full name, address, and date of birth?"

And when asked where you obtained the forged pass, your answer is received less than enthusiastically.
column3: 当处理你案件的人到达时, 你已经把天花板分成不同米色块并细数过了，又将失踪人员联系起来编成一个阴谋故事。你被处理人带到他的隔间，进行整套录入, 包括面部扫描、视网膜扫描、DNA采样、指纹采样和血样采样。整个面谈有点像某种喜剧，伴随着像是这样的问题："你的全名叫、住哪的、哪天出生？"当被问及你如何获得伪造通行证时，你的回答不太受欢迎。

column2: Scavenging a hex
column3: 搜刮

column2: Looking around you, there appear to be a few areas worth checking out.
column3: 环顾四周，你发现有几个值得一探究竟的地方。

column2: Booby trap
column3: 傻瓜陷阱

column2:
Booby trap!

You spring a hidden trap while trying to examine what looked like a hidden cache, and it causes some damage. You're lucky it didn't do worse.
column3: 傻瓜陷阱!当你试图调查一个看似隐蔽的箱子时弹出了一个隐藏的陷阱，它造成了一些伤害。你很幸运这并不严重。

column2: Scavenge a crumbling apartment building.
column3: 搜刮破败的公寓大楼

column2:
You decide to check out a crumbling apartment building. It's a mess inside: broken bricks lay in piles, bits of glass strewn everywhere like glittering dust, water stains and dead leaves litter the outer edges of the building, and rock dust still covers areas sheltered from the elements.

Scavengers before you have obviously picked most of the easy scores clean, but a little elbow grease and some risk-taking might reward the intrepid treasure-seeker.
column3: 你决定检查一栋摇摇欲坠的公寓楼。碎砖成堆，玻璃碎片像闪闪发光的灰尘一样到处都是，水渍和枯叶散落在建筑物的外缘，到处都覆盖着岩石和灰尘。在你之前的拾荒者显然已经把大部分东西都搜刮走了，但稍微用点力气，冒点险，可能会给勇敢的寻宝者带来回报。

column2: Scavenge with a prying tool.
column3: 用撬棍搜刮

column2: Use a tool to pry barriers loose during scavenging.
column3: 在搜刮过程中使用撬棍工具撬松障碍物。

column2: Scavenge an abandoned apartment building.
column3: 搜刮废弃的公寓楼

column2:
This concrete apartment building looks to be in better shape than most. Sure, the windows are all but gone and a giant fissure runs along one wall, but this place looks as if it could still provide suitable shelter for someone.

Perhaps that's what makes you feel so nervous about approaching it.
column3: 这栋混凝土公寓楼看起来比大多数公寓楼都要好。当然，窗户几乎都没了，一条巨大的裂缝沿着一面墙延伸到底，但这个地方看起来好像仍然可以为某人提供合适的住所。也许这就是让你对接近它感到如此紧张的原因。

column2: Scavenge an abandoned house.
column3: 搜刮废弃的房子

column2:
The suburbs were hit hard in the collapse. With masses of people fleeing urban centers in search of supplies, and supernatural threats encroaching from the wilds, the suburbs became the front lines in a war for survival.

Still, houses like these are so numerous that some have been entirely missed by scavengers. And they tend to be less likely to fall over than the bigger buildings in urban centers.
column3: 郊区在崩溃中受到重创。由于大量的人群逃离城市中心寻找物资，以及野外的超自然威胁，郊区成为了这场生存战争的前线。尽管如此，像这样的房子随处可见，以至于有些房子完全被拾荒者所遗漏。而且它们往往比城市中心的大型建筑更不容易倒塌。

column2: Scavenge an abandoned mobile home.
column3: 搜刮废弃的移动房屋

column2: Like other suburban homes, mobile homes were on the front lines in a war between fleeing urban populations and supernatural hordes from the wilds. However, their smaller size often means there's less to be found in each.
column3: 像其他的郊区住宅一样，移动房屋在人们从城市逃离和野外超自然威胁的生存战争中同样处于前线。然而，由于它们的尺寸较小，因此在每个房屋中发现的东西通常较少。

column2: Scavenge an abandoned office tower.
column3: 搜刮废弃的办公大楼

column2:
Due to their nature, office towers weren't primary looting targets during the food riots. More obvious targets got the most attention.

Later on, astute scavengers realized many offices had bottled water, and often kitchens. What's more, the supply closets often contained valuable survival tools. The supplies aren't expected to be great, but it's worth a shot.
column3: 由于其性质，办公大楼在食品骚乱期间并不是主要的抢劫目标。其他的目标得到了更多的关注。后来，精明的拾荒者意识到许多办公室内都有瓶装水，通常还有厨房。更重要的是，补给柜里往往有宝贵的生存工具。这些补给估计不会很好，但值得一试。

column2: Scavenge a destroyed office building.
column3: 搜刮被毁坏的办公大楼

column2: This office building is in ruins, and it's unlikely much survived its collapse. The creaking walls and ceiling are no boost to your confidence, either. Still, that may mean no one was brave enough (or perhaps desperate enough) to go in there.
column3: 这座办公大楼已成为废墟，不太可能有什么东西在倒塌中幸存下来。吱吱作响的墙壁和天花板也没有给你带来信心。不过，这可能意味着没有人有足够的勇气（或者是足够的绝望）进入那里。

column2: Scavenge a stretch of forest
column3: 搜刮一片森林

column2:
This stretch of forest seems to almost flourish in the absence of human life. There's a good chance one could find food and raw materials in here if they knew what to look for.

Just watch out for creatures that make this forest their home...and hunting ground.
column3: 在没有人类生活的情况下，这片森林似乎几乎蓬勃发展。如果人们知道要找什么，很有可能在这里找到食物和原材料。要小心那些以这片森林为家的生物......和猎物。

column2: Scavenge a forest shack
column3: 搜刮森林小屋

column2: Being far removed from urban centers, this secluded shack may have more promise. However, it could also be the home of a survivalist or militia member, so beware of booby traps.
column3: 这个僻远的小屋离市区很远，可能有着更多的希望。然而，它也可能是生存者或民兵的家，因此要小心陷阱。

column2: Scavenge an open field
column3: 搜刮一片空地

column2:
Open fields are scavengers' worst options, as anything of value here was likely already spotted and taken. Plus, there's hardly anywhere to hide. 

But hey, beggars can't be choosers.
column3: 空地是拾荒者最糟糕的选择，因为这里任何有价值的东西都可能已经被发现并拿走了。另外，这里几乎没有地方可以藏身。但嘿，乞丐是不能挑剔的。

column2: Scavenge a storage shed.
column3: 搜刮储藏室

column2: Storage sheds are mixed bags. Ostensibly there should be some goods inside. But then again, anyone here before you would've known that and cleaned it out. Still, it's worth a shot.
column3: 储藏室有着很多袋子。表面上看里面应该有一些货物。但话又说回来，在你之前的任何人都会知道这一点并把它搜刮掉。不过，这还是值得一试的。

column2: Pick the locks on the shed.
column3: 撬开锁

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2: Force your way past the lock.
column3: 强行撬开锁

column2:
Luckily, you were prepared for just such an occasion.

Now, let's see what's in here...
column3: 幸运的是，你已经为这样的场合做好了准备。现在，让我们看看这里有什么...

column2: DMC Junk Market
column3: 底特律垃圾市场

column2:
The Junk Market

As you navigate the winding alleys of DMC's Sprawl, you encounter a huge structure fashioned of shipping containers. Throngs of people enter and exit the structure through a doorway on one side. 

Inside, you can see a thriving bazaar where people trade scavenged items in the light of a thousand lanterns and bug zappers. The air is thick with sweat, smoke, and the smell of barbecue and spices.

This is the Sprawl's notorious Junk Market.
column3: 垃圾市场 当你在DMC延伸区的蜿蜒小巷中穿行时，你会遇到一个由集装箱制成的巨大结构。成群结队的人通过一侧的门口进出这个结构。在里面，你可以看到一个繁荣的集市，人们在千百个灯笼和驱虫器的照耀下交易捡来的物品。空气中弥漫着汗水、烟雾、烤肉还有香料的味道。这是延展区臭名昭著的垃圾市场。

column2: Dive Through the Window II
column3: 爬出窗外 II

column2:
The distant report of a gun disrupts your thoughts. You cock your head, listening, but it's over as quickly as it started.

Obviously, you're not alone out here. Though that doesn't necessarily comfort you.

Taking a look around you, you decide to start searching for some answers, not to mention supplies.
column3: 远处的枪声打断了你的思路。你歪着头听着，但很快就结束了。显然，你在这里不是一个人。虽然这不一定能让你感到安慰。看看你周围，你决定开始寻找一些答案，更不用说物资了。

column2: Scavenge using a squirrel snare
column3: 使用松鼠夹进行捕猎

column2: Use a squirrel snare to catch squirrels.
column3: 用松鼠夹捕捉松鼠。

column2: Hatter's Office
column3: 哈特的办公室

column2:
Hatter's office is in the husk of one of those flophouse hotels you'd see crammed between high-rises in a busy city. It even has the old marquee, hanging precariously from the cornerstones. Several floors up, armed guards watch over the street from missing sections of the building.

Hatter acknowledges the men at the door, and leads you through a surprisingly clean lobby to an old-fashioned elevator. The place is riddled with security cameras, even in the elevator.

"I have a client," he starts, pausing for the cage to rattle shut, "who collects heirlooms." He speaks louder, over the motor, "He compensates well. Well-enough, in fact, that I'd be willing to part with a DMC visitor's pass in exchange."

The elevator clunks to a halt, and the door rattles open, revealing a dark room lit by video screens and old lamps.
column3: 哈特的办公室位于那些挤在高楼之间的廉价酒店的外壳中。它甚至还保留着旧的招牌，悬挂在角石上，摇摇欲坠。几层楼高的地方，武装警卫从建筑缺失的部分俯瞰街道。哈特向门口的保安打了个招呼，然后带你穿过一个出乎意料地干净的大堂，走向一部老式电梯。这里到处都是监控摄像头，甚至在电梯里也不例外。"我有一个客户，" 他说道，电梯的笼子嘎吱作响地关上时停顿了一下，"他收藏古董。"他说话声音更大，超过了马达，”他很好地补偿了。他提高声音，盖过电梯的轰鸣声， "他付的报酬非常丰厚，实际上，我愿意用一张 DMC 访客通行证来交换。"电梯咯吱一声停下，门嘎吱作响地打开，露出一个由视频屏幕和老式灯具照亮的黑暗房间。

column2: Hatter's Office
column3: 哈特的办公室

column2:
Stepping off the elevator, it feels like you've walked into a control center built into an antique store. Baubles and relics crowd the walls and tabletops, while video screens and computer consoles cast a bluish tint on a handful of armed guards.

Hatter crosses the room to sit at a low, broad desk, facing the elevator. "There's a lake," he pulls a worn road atlas from a desk drawer, "about a day's walk northwest of here."

"Inside a building there is a silver urn." He pages through the atlas to a map of Michigan. "My guess is that you know a thing or two about getting around out there, and maybe this could be your ticket into the DMC."

He pauses to look up at you. "Interested?"
column3: 走出电梯，你感觉像是走进了一个建在古董店里的控制中心。墙上和桌面上挤满了饰品和文物，而监视器屏幕和计算机控制台在几个武装保卫员身上散发出蓝色的微光。哈特穿过房间，坐在一张低矮宽大的办公桌前，面对着电梯。"有一个湖，" 他从办公桌的抽屉里拿出一本破旧的公路地图， "从这里向西北走一天就到了。" "在一栋建筑里面有一个银色的骨灰盒。"他翻阅地图集，找到密歇根州的地图。"我猜你知道一两件关于在外面的事情，也许这可以成为你进入DMC的机会。"他暂停了一下，抬头看了看你。"有兴趣吗?"

column2: Give Hatter the security footage.
column3: 把监控录像给哈特看

column2:
Hatter slots the memory stick into one of his video monitors. As the footage plays out on Hatter's wall unit, you notice more than one bodyguard shift self-consciously, and another utters a low whistle. Hatter's lips curl into genuine satisfaction, and he leans back in his creaky, wooden chair.

"Maybe Christmas comes early this year. Tell you what, forget about the urn. The pass is yours."

"I need to message my contact so they add you to the system. We already have images of your face from the security cameras so that's one thing ready. That way your file actually appears when the guards scan your pass," Hatter says as he types in his device.

He then pulls a black wristband from a desk drawer, and extends it to you over the desk. "And hey," he says before letting go of it, "maybe you come around again when you're looking for some work. I think a few of these hotshots could learn a thing or two."
column3: 哈特将内存棒插入他的一台视频监视器中。当录像在哈特的墙面单元上播放时，你注意到几名保镖显得有些不自然地换了位置，另有一人低声吹了声口哨。哈特的嘴角露出真正的满意笑容，他靠在那把吱嘎作响的木椅上。"也许今年圣诞节来得有些早。我告诉你，忘了骨灰瓶吧。通行证是你的了。" "我需要联系我的联系人，让他们把你添加到系统中。我们已经从监控摄像头中获取了你的面部图像，所以这方面已经准备好了。这样，当保安扫描你的通行证时，你的档案就会出现，" 哈特一边在设备上打字，一边说道。随后，他从办公桌抽屉里拿出一只黑色手环，伸过桌子递给你。"对了，" 他在放手之前说，"也许你可以再来找我，当你需要工作的时候。我觉得这些高手们还能学到几招。"

column2: Hatter awaits a response.
column3: 哈特等待回应。

column2: "So, what'll it be?" Hatter says, picking up a jerry-rigged pocket computer, and thumbing through some list as he waits.
column3: "那么，它会是什么？"哈特一边说，一边拿起一台临时拼凑的口袋电脑，边等待着边用拇指翻阅着某个清单。

column2: New Ally
column3: 新盟友

column2:
"As a rule, I don't disclose client info like this." He stops the video. "But you seem like a decent type. More to the point, resourceful. And while money talks, I'll take a competent operative over cash any day."

He reaches into a drawer, and pulls out a small, black wristband. "The pass is yours. I'll keep my ear to the ground for any info on this reaper fellow, and let you know."

"I will message my contact so they add you to the system. We already have images of your face from the security cameras so that's one thing ready. That way your file actually appears when the guards scan your pass," Hatter says as he hands you a black wristband.

"And hey," he says before letting go of it, "maybe you come around again when you're looking for some work."
column3: "一般来说，我不会像这样透露客户信息。"他暂停了视频，"但你看起来是个不错的人。更重要的是，你足智多谋。虽然钱能说话，但我更愿意选择一个能干的干员，而不是现金。"他从抽屉里拿出一个小小的黑色手环。"通行证是你的了。我会留意关于这个死神的任何信息，并及时通知你。""我会联系我的联系人，让他们把你添加到系统中。我们已经从监控摄像头中获取了你的面部图像，所以这方面已经准备好了。这样，当保安扫描你的通行证时，你的档案就会出现，" 哈特说着，将黑色手环递给你。"对了，" 他在放手之前说， "也许你可以再来找我，当你需要工作的时候。"

column2: Install the new security screens.
column3: 安装新的安全屏幕

column2:
Installing the iSlabs turns out to be pretty easy. You end up having to bypass the battery circuit and adapt the video signal cables, but Hatter is more than happy to let you use spare parts from old equipment he's collected.

When finished, you climb down from the paisley footstool you borrowed, and the two of you survey your work. "You're a handy one," he admits, a bit of surprise in his voice. "I believe that means I owe you something." He heads back to his desk, opening a drawer.

"Your visitor's pass," he says, handing you a black wristband. "Now, to message my contact so they add you to the system. We already have images of your face from the security cameras so that's one thing ready. That way your file actually appears when the guards scan your pass," Hatter says as he types on his device.

As you make your way back to the elevator, you hear the grunt of a guard lifting one of the old 21-inch monitors.
column3: iSlabs 的安装非常简单。你最终不得不绕过电池电路，并调整视频信号电缆，但哈特非常乐意让你使用他收藏的旧设备中的备用零件。完成后，你从借来的花卉图案脚凳上下来，你们两人检查了一下你的工作。"你真是个能干的人，" 他带着一丝惊讶的语气承认道， "我想这意味着我欠你一些东西。"“我相信这意味着我欠你一些东西。”他回到办公桌前，打开一个抽屉。"这是你的访客通行证，" 他边说边递给你一个黑色手环。"现在，我需要联系我的联系人，让他们把你添加到系统中。我们已经从监控摄像头中获取了你的面部图像，所以这方面已经准备好了。这样，当保安扫描你的通行证时，你的档案就会出现，" 哈特一边在设备上打字，一边说。当你回到电梯时，你听到一名保安在搬运一台旧的 21 英寸显示器时发出的咕哝声。

column2: Denied Entry - Exile I
column3: 拒绝进入 - 流放 I

column2:
You're not really sure why you're getting back in this line, after all that's happened. It's not like your sentence is up, and you're pretty sure their computer doesn't have faulty memory. Still, maybe there's a chance you'll slip through.

At the front of the line, you're made to stop and submit to a scan. The monitor flashes.

"Exile N6MAA64843 Denied"

"You kidding me?" the guard asks, incredulous. He pulls you to the side. "Don't you...?"

Then, he pushes you away from the gate. "You're just making it worse, you know!"

His frustration spills over to the next guy, who casts a scowl your way.

So much for that idea.
column3: 事到如今，你真的不知道自己为什么要回来排队。你的刑期也并未届满，你也确信他们的电脑没有内存故障。不过，也许你仍有机会溜进去。在队伍的前头，你必须停下来接受扫描。那显示屏刷新了。"流放者 N6MAA64843 被拒绝" "你在开玩笑吗?"他把你拉到一边。他把你拉到一边。"你不是...?" 然后，他把你推离大门。"你只会让事情变得更糟，你知道吗!"他的沮丧情绪传染给了下一个人，那人朝你投来一副愁苦的表情。看来这个主意泡汤了。

column2: Busted knuckles
column3: 指关节受伤

column2:
Busted knuckles.

While forcing open a promising-looking container, your hand slips, leaving you with a sore hand. 

It's nothing serious, but it has hampered your scavenging efforts for now.
column3: 指关节受伤。当你强行打开一个看起来很有料的容器时，你的手滑了，手好疼。这并不严重，但它暂时影响了你的搜刮工作。

column2: Stuck in an opening
column3: 卡在了一个口子里

column2:
Stuck in an opening.

While trying to gain access, you get stuck crawling through an opening in the debris.

You manage to wriggle free again, but not without straining your back in the process. You also lost quite a bit of time in the ordeal.
column3: 你被卡在开口处。在试图进入时，你被卡在入口的废墟处。你设法再次挣脱，但在这个过程中你的背部不免有些紧张。你也在这场意外中浪费了不少时间。

column2: Cut on some broken glass
column3: 被一些碎玻璃划伤

column2:
Cut on some broken glass.

It was a stupid mistake, but while trying to get inside through a window, you cut yourself on some broken glass you failed to notice.

It'll sting for a while, but it isn't anything serious.
column3: 被一些碎玻璃划伤。这是个愚蠢的错误，但在试图通过窗户进入室内时，你被一些你没有注意到的碎玻璃划伤。伤痛会持续一会儿，不过还好并不严重。

column2: Inside Zom Zom's
column3: 再次进入僵僵食堂

column2:
Inside, it's one part superclub, one part gladiator pit. A wall of sound assaults your ears as you cross the threshold: part human cacophony, part generator exhaust, mostly frenetic industrial music. And the smell of food and smoke. You can't hear it over the noise, but you can feel your stomach rumble at the smell of sweet barbecue.

The cavernous warehouse is dominated by a dirt-floored arena, with high mesh walls. Spectators ring the pit on three sides, the fourth reserved for a large garage door leading outside into the tarp-fenced courtyard. Beyond the door, you catch the flash of welding arcs, where it appears scrapyard robots are being prepped.

And opposite the garage door, the thing you really care about right now: a wide booth with grills spewing sweet and spicy smoke into the rafters above. People clamor to get at it, and walk away with their prize smeared over hands and lips alike: barbecue.
column3: 里面，一部分是超级俱乐部，一部分是角斗士坑。当你跨过门槛时，一堵声音墙冲击着你的耳朵：一部分是人类的不和谐声音，一部分是发电机的废气，大部分是狂热的工业音乐。还有食物和烟味。你听不到噪音，但你能感觉到你的胃在甜甜的烤肉味中隆隆作响。这个洞穴般的仓库主要是一个泥土地板的竞技场，有高高的网状墙。观众围着坑的三面，第四面是为一个大车库门保留的，通向外面用防水布围起来的院子。门外，你会看到焊接电弧的闪光，那里似乎正在准备废品场的机器人。在车库门的对面，你现在真正关心的是：一个宽阔的隔间，烤架向上面的椽子喷出又甜又辣的烟。人们吵着要吃它，然后带着他们的奖品离开：烧烤。

column2: The Grill
column3: 烧烤

column2:
"Free barbecue! Grab your free skewer now, before the next fight! A chance once in a lifetime!" you hear as you get closer to the crowd. It seems handouts are not common in here.
			
You wade through dirty patrons, intent on manhandling some ribs, or beans and rice, or whatever it is they've got cooking over there. Who knows how long you've been in cryo? How long it's been since you've had a hot meal?

Pressing your way through this final wall of hungry patrons, you get an elbow on the counter, and desperately try to make eye contact with one of the servers. A few eternal minutes later, one of the apron-clad food-slingers glances at you, and you nod like an excited dog. He reaches into a smoker box, withdraws a loaded skewer, and places it in your hand. Sweet, succulent barbecue.

Savoring it at first, you start to grow paranoid that it'll be snatched from your hands, and you bear down on it with renewed fervor, huddling with it against your lips as you absently walk away from the grill.
column3: "免费烤肉!现在就拿起你的免费烤肉串，在下一场比赛之前!一生中只有一次的机会!"当你走近人群时，你会听到这样的声音。看来施舍在这里并不常见。 你挤过人群，只想找点排骨或者豆子、米饭什么的。天晓得你休眠多久了？你已经有多久没有饱餐一顿了？好不容易穿过饥饿的人群，你的手肘搭在柜台上，拼命地试图与其中一个服务员进行眼神交流。几分钟后，其中一个身穿围裙的食物推销员瞥了你一眼，你像条狗一样兴奋地点头。他从一个烤架里拿出一串肉，放在你的手里。鲜嫩多汁的烤肉。起初你还在品味它，后来你开始有点偏执地认为有人会抢你的烤肉，于是你更加疯狂了起来，在离开烧烤架的同时，嘴巴紧紧地咬着并吮吸着肉串内所有的汁水。

column2: Give him the bracelet.
column3: 把手镯给他。

column2:
You snap the printed bracelet from your wrist, and hand it to him. He slides it through his fingers, reading the lettering on the strap.

"Niiice, dude," he bobs his head, "I may have to do an expedition there. And, and! Nice naaaame, ha ha." He pulls a box out from under a flightcase near the combine bot.

"Here." He opens the box. "Unclaimed lost and found, let's say."
column3: 你从手腕上摘下印花手镯，递给他。他把它滑过手指，读着表带上的字母。他摇摇头，“我可能得去那里探险了。”还有，还有！很好，哈哈。”他从联合收割机机器人附近的飞行箱下拿出一个盒子。"在这。他打开盒子。“可以说是无人认领的失物招领。”

column2: Just give him the info.
column3: 把信息给他就行了。

column2:
Unsure whether you want to give up the strap, you self-consciously fidget with it a moment, then read it over once more. Instead, you decide to share the facility address, but keep your name to yourself.

"Smart," he says, tapping the side of his head with his index finger. "You're a smart dude. Tell you what." He pulls a box out from under a flight case near the combine bot.

"Here." He opens the box. "Unclaimed lost and found, let's say. As for me, I may have to check into your fancy clinic soon. I think I'm coming down with a little something." He fake coughs and clears his throat, grinning.
column3: 不确定你是否想放弃表带，你下意识地摆弄了一会儿，然后再读一遍。相反，你决定分享设施地址，但保留你的名字。“聪明，”他说，用食指敲了敲头的一侧。“你是个聪明人。告诉你吧。”他从联合收割机机器人附近的飞行箱下拿出一个盒子。"在这。他打开盒子。“可以说是无人认领的失物招领处。至于我，我可能很快就要去你的豪华诊所了。我想我得了点小病。”他假装咳嗽，清了清嗓子，咧嘴一笑。

column2: Approach the mine.
column3: 接近矿井。

column2:
Climbing a barren hill, you notice a trail heading off into a narrow ravine. Moisture-loving slime clings to the walls. Plastic detritus eddies and swirls.

Off to one side, you notice a pile of bones. The large, cracked skull reminds you of a moose- at least that's what you think it is.

Ragged, battered bones. Bleached. A pair of men's trousers snagged on a bush nearby. Died eating tainted meat? 

Wouldn't be the first to fight the maggots for a piece of rotting animal flesh, you'd wager.
column3: 爬上一座荒山，你会注意到一条通向狭窄峡谷的小径。喜湿的粘液粘在墙上。塑料碎屑漩涡和漩涡。在一边，你会注意到一堆骨头。巨大而破裂的头骨让你想起了驼鹿——至少你是这么认为的。破烂的骨头。漂白的。一条男裤挂在附近的灌木丛上。吃了受污染的肉而死？你敢打赌，他不会是第一个为了一块腐烂的动物肉而与蛆虫战斗的人。

column2: Approach the mine cont'd.
column3: 继续接近矿井。

column2:
The ravine walls pinch in like the lips of an angry, disapproving spouse. Ducking under an overhanging rock, you realize how vulnerable you are. Trapped in the narrow gut of the ravine and unable to climb the slippery, slime-covered walls, you are easy prey.

Maybe that's how they got the moose?

Then you notice the sign. Hard not to. Hand-painted letters on weathered board, head height and hammered onto a rustic door: "Isotope Mine. Beware of the Tiger!"

Closer to this door at the side, there's a noticeably sturdier, metal door but it's locked.
column3: 峡谷的墙壁像愤怒的、不赞成的配偶的嘴唇一样挤压着。躲在一块突出的岩石下，你会意识到自己是多么脆弱。被困在狭窄的峡谷中，无法爬上光滑、布满粘液的墙壁，你很容易成为猎物。也许他们就是这样得到驼鹿的？然后你注意到了这个标志。很难不去。风化板上的手绘字母，头部高度，敲在一扇质朴的门上：“同位素矿。小心老虎！”靠近这扇门的一侧，有一扇明显更坚固的金属门，但它是锁着的。

column2: Leave the mine.
column3: 离开该地区

column2: You decide to not press further, and leave the mine instead.
column3: 你决定不再继续前进，而是离开矿井。

column2: Cross the lobby.
column3: 穿过大厅。

column2:
Moving across the lobby, you notice a hidden alcove. You freeze upon the realization that a large animal lurks within.

Its eyes look strangely dead, though. The overlong fangs protruding from its mouth remind you of a prehistoric documentary you once saw as a child. Woolly mammoths roamed the planet in all their 3D, holographic glory. Roamed far and wide. Kept roaming until a saber-toothed tiger pack clawed up their backs and brought them crashing to the ground.
column3: 穿过大厅，你会注意到一个隐藏的壁龛。当你意识到一只大型动物潜伏在里面时，你愣住了。不过，它的眼睛看起来奇怪地死气沉沉。从它嘴里伸出的过长的尖牙让你想起小时候看过的一部史前纪录片。长毛猛犸象在他们所有的3D全息荣耀中漫游在这个星球上。四处游荡。一直游荡，直到一群剑齿虎抓住他们的背，把他们撞倒在地。

column2: Radiation Bob
column3: 辐射鲍勃

column2:
Looking around, you are surprised to find yourself in a large, clinically white, well-lit room. Dials, shelves, and instrumentation are arrayed in neat rows along the walls. Dishevelled signs of human habitation everywhere else.

Before you is a short, owlish man dressed in a dirty laboratory coat, peering through coke-bottle glasses. Radiation dosimeters cover his chest, all tinted deep red.

Bending, he offers you an oil-stained hand. Struggling to your feet, you gather your thoughts.

"Bob," says the radiated mole, introducing himself. "Damn tiger ain't been working proper fer days. Bad fer business." Bob seems more concerned with the tiger than your well-being.
column3: 环顾四周，你会惊讶地发现自己在一个大的、临床白色的、光线充足的房间里。表盘、架子和仪器沿着墙壁整齐地排列着。其他地方到处都是人类居住的凌乱迹象。在你面前的是一个矮小、猫头鹰般的男人，穿着一件肮脏的实验室外套，透过可乐瓶玻璃杯窥视。辐射剂量计覆盖在他的胸部，都是深红色的。他弯下腰，伸出一只沾满油污的手。挣扎着站起来，你整理思绪。“鲍勃，”辐射鼹鼠说，自我介绍。“该死的老虎已经好几天没正常工作了。生意不好。”鲍勃似乎更关心老虎而不是你的幸福。

column2: Radiation Bob cont'd.
column3: 辐射鲍勃继续。

column2:
"Ol' Gertrude's mine. Saber-toothed tiger. Made 'er myself." Bob waves his hands, encompassing most of the well-equipped room. "Surprising whatcha can rig with the right kit and plenny of time on yer hands. Saw a fancy version once. In a museum. Made myself a copy, or two. Metal version."

"First one left before I could even name 'er. Messed 'er code up somewhere, I reckon." he continues.

"Trouble is, certain folk jus' don't get it. Get that I provide a desirable service to the locals. Don't like what I do." Bob picks up a modified food can and tosses it over to you. "See that? RTG power cell. Couple a thermocouples hooked up to a pew two-three-eight isotope. Hot bricks, I call 'em. Enough power there ta keep the lights on 'til winter."
column3: “老格特鲁德是我的。剑齿虎。我自己做的。”鲍勃挥挥手，包围了大部分设备齐全的房间。“令人惊讶的是，您可以使用正确的套件和充足的时间来装备。看过一次花哨的版本。在博物馆里。给自己复印了一两份。金属版。”“我还没来得及说出儿的名字，第一个就走了。我猜是她把密码弄乱了。”他继续说道。“问题是，有些人不明白。让我为当地人提供令人满意的服务。不喜欢我做的事。”鲍勃拿起一个改良食品罐，扔给你。“看到了吗？破损的RTG电池将热电偶连接到皮尤二三八同位素上。我称之为热砖。那里的电力足够让灯亮到冬天。”

column2: Look over Gertrude's code cont'd.
column3: 看看格特鲁德的密码。

column2:
Bob reaches into a nearby cupboard and pulls out a strange object which he passes to you. "A fella like you might find a use for this one day."

Staring at it, you doubt it. Your days of playing with dolls are long gone. The dolls of your childhood were all action figures, not strange-looking mechanical contraptions like this one. Still, a gift is a gift.

"A good Samaritan, then, lucky me. Don't forget to visit, I might have things to trade with ya," he says.

You thank Bob and get on your way, hoping you didn't pick up too many rads from that tiger.
column3: 鲍勃把手伸进附近的橱柜，拿出一个奇怪的东西递给你。“像你这样的家伙，总有一天会用得上这个的。”盯着它，你怀疑它。你玩洋娃娃的日子早已一去不复返了。你童年时的洋娃娃都是活动人偶，而不是像这个这样看起来很奇怪的机械装置。尽管如此，礼物就是礼物。“那么，一个好撒玛利亚人，我很幸运。别忘了去看看，我可能有东西要和你交易，”他说。你感谢鲍勃，然后上路，希望你没有从那只老虎身上得到太多的拉德。

column2: Offer to do what you can cont'd.
column3: 主动提出尽你所能。

column2:
Ten minutes later you begin to feel warm. Twenty minutes in and you're so hot that sweat is starting to roll down your cheeks and drip, drip, dripping onto the inner workings of the tiger. Investigating, you determine that the heat is emanating from the rear of the beast. Opening a hatch cover, one of Bob's 'hot bricks' peeks cheekily out at you.

With a start, you remember. A jury-rigged food can, power cell full of plutonium isotopes. Bad. Disastrously bad.

Disgusted, you give the beast a hefty kick and leave, searching for Bob to tell him that he'll have to fix it himself. Still angry, you wonder if you have Bob to thank for cancer now.
column3: 十分钟后，你开始感到温暖。二十分钟后，你太热了，汗水开始从你的脸颊滚下来，滴，滴到老虎的内部。通过调查，你确定热量是从野兽的后部散发出来的。打开舱门，鲍勃的一块“热砖”厚颜无耻地向你窥视。一开始，你就记得。陪审团操纵的食品罐，充满钚同位素的电池。坏的。糟糕透顶。厌恶地，你给了野兽一个沉重的踢，然后离开，寻找鲍勃告诉他，他将不得不自己修理它。仍然很生气，你想知道你现在是否要感谢鲍勃的癌症。

column2: Treat Bob's rad poisoning cont'd.
column3: 继续治疗鲍勃的放射性中毒。

column2:
"Can't say I feel any different. Can't feel my hair growing back. Sure that gizmo is working?" 

You assure Bob that he is now a healthier man and will live to see next Christmas.

"No kidding? Gizmo is that good, huh? Well that's mighty fine of you to help. Tell you what, here's a little something in return." Bob hands across an average-sized doll. A mechanical, not particularly attractive, doll. "Don't be put off by its ugly mug; could come in handy one day."

Underwhelmed by Bob's generosity, you get the distinct feeling that you've been had. Of course, so might he.

"Come again," gushes an effusive Bob, shaking your hands. "Always welcome. Who knows, I might need another shot from the gizmo one day. Let me walk you out. Don't want ol' Gertie thinking you're a damn guva-munt agent, do we?"
column3: “不能说我感觉有什么不同。感觉不到我的头发长回来了。你确定这个小发明能用吗？”你向鲍勃保证，他现在是一个更健康的人，会活着看到明年圣诞节。“没开玩笑吧？小发明很棒，是吧？你能帮忙真是太好了。告诉你吧，这里有一点回报。”鲍勃递给一个中等大小的洋娃娃。一个机械的，不是特别吸引人的娃娃。“别被它丑陋的杯子吓跑了，总有一天它会派上用场的。”鲍勃的慷慨给你留下了深刻的印象，你会明显地感觉到你被欺骗了。当然，他也可能会。“再来，”鲍勃热情洋溢地和你握手。总能成功。谁知道呢，有一天我可能需要从这个小发明中再拍一张照片。让我送你出去。你可不想让老格蒂以为你是个该死的古瓦蒙特特工吧？”

column2: Exchange the talisman for the rifle.
column3: 把护身符换成步枪。

column2:
"Hey, that's real generous of you. Here, may as well take this clip with ammo, too. Could be helpful out there. Promise you'll save a bullet for any guva-munt agents you cross. Aim for their peckers!" Bob doubles up in another spasm of asthmatic laughter. Recovering, he turns suddenly serious.

"You need ta head ta the DMC, fella. Safer. Go straight there. The black marsh to the south'll kill ya dead, and the north ain't much better. Head straight for the gates. I've heard bad things happen to those that take the scenic route."

Bob shakes your hand and wishes you well. "I'll deactivate Gertrude so you can leave. Be seein' you."
column3: “嘿，你真是太慷慨了。在这里，不妨把这个弹夹和弹药一起拿走。可能会有帮助。答应我你会为你遇到的任何guva-munt特工省下一颗子弹。瞄准他们的老二！”鲍勃又笑得喘不过气来。恢复中，他突然变得严肃起来。“你需要ta领导Ta DMC，伙计。更安全。一直往那里走。南边的黑沼泽会杀了你，北边也好不到哪里去。直奔大门。我听说过那些走风景优美路线的人会发生不好的事情。”鲍勃和你握手，祝你一切顺利。“我会让格特鲁德停用，这样你就可以离开了。再见。”

column2: Exchange the talisman for the location.
column3: 用护身符换位置。

column2:
"Alright. Deal's a deal. Yer lookin' fer the Allegan Fairgrounds. A bit northwest of here. Can't miss it. Acres and acres. Even got a ferris wheel." Then he mocks a frightened look, "Just watch fer clowns!" Bob doubles up in another spasm of asthmatic laughter. Recovering, he turns suddenly serious.

"Serious now, don't dally there for long. Get watcha need and get out. Best bet is ta head ta the DMC, fella. Safer. And when ya do, go straight there. The black marsh to the south'll kill ya dead, and the north ain't much better. Head straight for the gates. I've heard bad things happen to those that take the scenic route."

Bob shakes your hand and wishes you well. "I'll deactivate Gertrude so you can leave. Be seein' you."
column3: "很好。一言为定。你在找阿勒根游乐场。就在这里的西北方向。不能错过。一英亩又一英亩。甚至还有摩天轮。”然后他嘲笑一个害怕的表情，“看看小丑！”鲍勃又笑得喘不过气来。恢复中，他突然变得严肃起来。“说真的，别在那里磨蹭太久了。得到你需要的手表，然后出去。最好的办法就是去DMC，伙计。更安全。当你这样做的时候，直接去那里。南边的黑沼泽会杀了你，北边也好不到哪里去。直奔大门。我听说过那些走风景优美路线的人会发生不好的事情。”鲍勃和你握手，祝你一切顺利。“我会让格特鲁德停用，这样你就可以离开了。再见。”

column2: Leaving the Mine Lobby
column3: 离开矿山大厅

column2:
But no tiger appears.
			
You make it to the door, shoulder it open without breaking stride, and keep running.
column3: 但是没有老虎出现。你走到门口，用肩膀打开门，不要停下脚步，继续跑。

column2: Leaving the Mine Lobby
column3: 离开矿山大厅

column2:
But not fast enough.

With a wobbly, mechanical pounce, the saber-toothed terror is upon you. Knocked sideways, you feel sharp metal fangs rake across your back, but you retain your feet and manage to stagger out the entrance door. You can hear the tiger ricocheting off the walls back in the mine lobby.

Despite the pain, you run the length of the ravine, putting the Isotope Mine out of sight and out of mind. You finally come to a halt at the head of the trail and attempt to do something about the gaping wounds in your back. It's not the loss of blood or the flapping flesh that worries you; it's infection.

Those fangs looked about as sterile as a bucket full of flyblown moose gizzards.
column3: 但还不够快。随着一个摇摇欲坠的机械猛扑，剑齿虎的恐怖向你袭来。被撞到一边，你会感觉到锋利的金属尖牙掠过你的背部，但你保持住了双脚，并设法摇摇晃晃地走出了大门。你可以听到老虎从矿井大厅的墙上弹跳的声音。尽管很痛苦，你还是跑过了峡谷的长度，把同位素矿看不见也想不起来。你终于在小路的尽头停下来，试图对你背上裂开的伤口做些什么。让你担心的不是失血或拍打的肉；是感染。那些尖牙看起来就像一桶被苍蝇吹走的驼鹿腮一样无菌。

column2: Reenter the cryo chamber.
column3: 重新进入冷冻室

column2:
Back in the cryo chamber, you still feel echoes of the panic that gripped you when you awoke here. It leaves you feeling unsettled.

However, that time has passed. Maybe it's time to look around again?
column3: 回到冷冻室后，当你在这里醒来时的恐慌仍然回荡在你的心中，这让你感到不安。它让你感到不安。然而，那段时间已经过去了。也许现在是时候再看看周围了？

column2: Explore down the hall.
column3: 沿着大厅探索

column2:
Outside the cryo chamber, there's a debris-filled corridor that looks disused. You climb over piles of refuse and rubble, and come across several rooms in poor condition.
			
You find a closed room. The door and access panel are functional but locked. A plaque on the wall reads: "Exam Rm 14"
			
You decide to continue down the corridor. You eventually find a blocked doorway. A plaque on the wall reads: "Exam Rm 17"

Forcing the barricade aside, you peer into what looks like a clinic exam room. While there appears to be little worth looting, this room looks like it'd make a great hole-up site.

(Exam Room 17 has been added to this hex's campsites.)
column3: 在冷冻室外面，有一条充满碎石的走廊，看起来已经废弃。你爬过成堆的垃圾和瓦砾，发现了几个状况不佳的房间。你找到一个房间。门和进入面板是功能性的，但锁定了。墙上有一块牌子，上面写着："检查室 14" 你决定继续沿着走廊走。最终，你找到了一个被堵住的门口。墙上的牌子写着："检查室 17" 强行推开障碍，你窥视着一个看起来像诊所的检查室。虽然这里没什么值得拿走的东西，但这个房间看起来是个很好的藏身之处。（17号检查室已被添加到营地列表中）

column2: Good 1.1
column3: 良好1.1

column2:
Sitting on a decaying park bench, aiming his gun at your chest, is a scarred, flint-eyed man. From the kit and urban camo clothing, you can tell he's ronin. A gun for hire. He's airing his feet, one profusely bleeding from a recent gash. Probably the same gash that caused that rip through the sole of his shoe. A lot of sharp metal around these parts.

The pain must be affecting his grip on the rifle. It's wavering. Maybe enough for you to safely dive off to the side. He's not saying anything. Just sitting there, staring.
column3: 坐在一张破旧的公园长椅上，用枪指着你的胸口，是一个伤痕累累、目光冷酷的男人。从装备和城市迷彩服，你可以看出他是浪人。一把出租的枪。他正在晾干他的脚，一只脚因最近的伤口而大量出血。很可能是导致他鞋底撕裂的同一个伤口。这些零件周围有很多锋利的金属。疼痛一定影响了他对步枪的握持。它在摇摆不定。也许足以让你安全地跳到一边。他什么都没说。只是坐在那里，盯着看。

column2: Only thing better than a nearly dead ronin is a dead one. Finish him. Otherwise, he might recover.
column3: 唯一比快死的浪人好的就是死了的浪人。干掉他。否则，他可能会康复。

column2:
Rock to the head. Man, did he have to splatter so much blood onto you? It's like he wanted to spite you one more time.

Hope he didn't have any of those nasty blood borne diseases.
column3: 摇摇头。伙计，他非得把这么多血溅到你身上吗？好像他想再来一次刁难你。希望他没有那些讨厌的血液传播疾病。

column2: Only thing better than a nearly dead ronin is a dead one. Finish him. Otherwise, he might recover.
column3: 唯一比快死的浪人好的就是死了的浪人。干掉他。否则，他可能会康复。

column2:
Rock to the head. Man, did he have to splatter so much blood onto you? It's like he wanted to spite you one more time.

Hope he didn't have any of those nasty blood borne diseases.
column3: 摇摇头。伙计，他非得把这么多血溅到你身上吗？好像他想再来一次刁难你。希望他没有那些讨厌的血液传播疾病。

column2: Meat Peddler Warning
column3: 肉贩警告

column2:
You plead with the butcher, and explain that it must be some mistake. You don't kill humans for meat, honest!

Giving you a sidelong stare, the butcher considers your plea. "If I ever," he points a carving knife at you, "and I mean EVER, see you in here offloading that stuff again..." His knife jabs point-first into a stall table, nearly splitting the wood.

"Now get yourself out of my sight, or else!" he spits as he walks back to his stall.

"You should leave now, lad." another merchant advices. "Come back in few days or in a week. Things should be calmer by then."
column3: 你恳求着屠夫，解释说肯定是误会了。你不会为了肉而杀人,千真万确!他斜眼瞄着你，思索着你的恳求。"如果我哪天，" 他用刻刀指着你， "我说只要哪天，再看到你搬着那东西..."他把刀一把插到砧板上，都快把砧板切开了。"现在马上滚出我的视线，否则!" 他一边吐着口水一边走回他的摊位。"你现在应该离开，小伙子。" 另一位商人建议道。"几天后或一周后再来吧。到时候事情应该会平息下来。 "

column2: Enter the Red Gnome.
column3: 进入红侏儒

column2:
Pushing through the stainless steel door, a rush of warm, greasy air fills your nose, replacing the damp coolness from outside. Your stomach "urps" almost instantly, in anticipation of whatever you smell on the grill.

The decor is somewhat less inviting, however. Despite a number of lights, most of them seem incapable of dispelling the dimness in the space. And sepia-stained curio along the walls seem to capture more of the creepy awkwardness of the diner's history than nostalgia. Padded stools line the long countertop, and booths run the length of the outer wall, sporting ripped vinyl benches. A stark pattern of 1-inch tiles dots the floor.

Not surprising, in retrospect, that the take-out line was so long. Still, an open seat and a warm meal are promised land compared to eating condensed soup in the rain. You shove your stuff into an empty booth, and start paging through the laminated menu.
column3: 推开不锈钢的门，一股温暖油腻的空气扑面而来，取代了外面湿冷的气息。你的胃几乎立刻有些不适，是对烤架上气味的预感。然而，装潢就不那么令人愉快了。尽管有不少灯光，但大多数灯似乎无法驱散空间中的昏暗。墙上的棕褐色古董装饰似乎捕捉了更多餐馆历史中的怪异气氛，而不是怀旧感。长长的台面上摆满了有垫子的凳子，外墙沿线的包厢有破损的乙烯基长椅。地板上点缀着一寸见方的明显图案瓷砖。回头看来，外卖队伍那么长也就不足为奇了。尽管如此，与在雨中吃浓缩汤相比，一个空座位和一顿热饭就显得像是应许之地。你把东西塞进一个空包厢，开始翻阅那本塑料封面的菜单。

column2: Order Combo 1: Fried chicken, mac and cheese, and red beans with rice. Price - $24.50
column3: 套餐一：炸鸡，吉士汉堡，红豆饭。价格 - $24.50

column2:
For once, fried chicken might be the healthiest thing for you. After days in the wild, a little bit of body fat might actually do you some good!

When it arrives, you can almost taste the greasy spices from its intoxicating scent. Forgoing utensils, you dive into the chicken, and it slides easily off the bone, into your gullet.

The mac and cheese is rich and creamy, and the beans and rice feels like it'll fill your stomach for days. If paradise was a dish, it'd be fried chicken in front of a starving scavenger.
column3: 这一次，炸鸡可能算是健康的食物了。因为在野外的日子，有一点脂肪可能确实对你会有好处。当菜端上来时，你几乎可以闻到那油腻腻的香料所散发出的醉人香味。拿起餐具，你开始吃那炸鸡，它是吃起来那样的美味香滑。通心粉和奶酪量多且爽口，豆子和米饭感觉可以填饱你的肚子好几天。如果天堂是一道菜，那它绝对就是一盘放在拾荒者面前的炸鸡了。

column2: Order Combo 3: Cadillac burger, mashed potatoes with gravy, and cornbread. Price - $32.50
column3: 套餐三：凯迪拉克汉堡，肉汁土豆泥，玉米面包。价格 - $32.50

column2:
In true diner fashion, you don't have to wait long for your plate. It arrives hot, the aroma of gravy, cornbread, and beef carried by thin wisps of steam.

The burger is more meatloaf than patty, topped with elbow macaroni and ketchup. What this has to do with a Cadillac, you're not sure.

But man, does it ever hit the spot. As you smush the soft food around your mouth, you look around the room at the various photos and decor.
column3: 在真正的餐馆中，你不必为上菜而等待太久。店家会为你端上热气腾腾的充满肉汁香气的玉米面包，还有一份用蒸汽蒸熟的牛肉。汉堡比肉饼更像是肉饼，上面浇满了通心粉和番茄酱。这与凯迪拉克有什么关系，你不确定。但是，伙计，这些都没有说到点子上。你环顾着房间里的各种照片和装饰，就像你把柔软的食物塞进嘴里时地动作那么顺畅。

column2: Order Combo 2: Jumbo fried shrimp, collard greens, black-eyed peas, and peach cobbler. Price: - $20
column3: 套餐二：巨型炸虾，菠菜，豇豆，桃汁。 价格：- $20

column2:
Your eyes fixated on the kitchen door, you wait impatiently for the food. Doesn't even have to be your order. You'll gladly accept a misdelivered plate.

When it does arrive, you have to restrain yourself from going feral on the dinner. With some effort, you take a controlled bite of the first piece of shrimp.

Your mouth floods with saliva. There's a stinging sensation radiating from the side of your tongue as flavor drips over it.

Pecking around the plate, you sample the sides, mixing them in your mouth. The savory flavors compliment each other, rounded out by the sweet and sour of the peach.
column3: 你的眼睛紧盯着厨房的门口，不耐烦地等待着食物。甚至不一定是你点的菜。你会很乐意接受一个送错的盘子。上菜了之后，你不得不克制自己，避免在晚餐上狼吞虎咽。经过努力，你优雅的吞下了第一口虾肉。你的嘴里充斥着唾液。当食物刺激到了你的味蕾时，那味道从你舌头的两侧慢慢的蔓延开来。桌上的盘子转了一圈，你尝了一下两边的配菜，把它们在嘴里混合起来。咸味相互补充，再加上桃子的酸甜味，使之更加完美。

column2: Pay for the meal.
column3: 结账

column2:
It's one of the pricier meals, but you suspect getting real beef in this city is a tall order. And judging by the business this place is doing through take-out, it doesn't have much competition. At least, not out here between Core City and the walls.

You pay for the meal, then a thought occurs to you: do people still tip?
column3: 这真是一顿昂贵的饭，但是你怀疑在这个城市吃到真正的牛肉是一件难事。从这个地方的外卖业务来看，它没有多少竞争。至少没有在核心城和城墙之间。你付了饭钱，然后突然想到：人们还会给小费吗？

column2: Pay the bill.
column3: 买单

column2:
Real shrimp in Detroit, huh? You guess that's not impossible. Shrimp farming is pretty high-density stuff.

And $20 is hardly a cheap plate. But hey, that feeling in your stomach is worth almost any price.

You pay for the meal, then a thought occurs to you: do people still tip?
column3: 底特律还有真正的虾？你猜这不是不可能的。虾的养殖是相当高密度的东西。而且20美元算不上一顿便宜的餐。但是，嘿，你肚子里的那种感觉几乎是值得的。你为这顿饭付了钱，然后你想到了一个问题：人们还会给小费吗？

column2: Enter the Red Gnome.
column3: 进入红侏儒

column2:
Pushing through the front door, the familiar smells of soul food fill your nose. As usual, there are a few empty booths, and you slide into one, making yourself comfortable.

You pick up a menu.
column3: 推开前门，熟悉的灵魂食品香气扑鼻而来。像往常一样，有几个空包厢，你滑进了一个，舒适地坐下。你拿起菜单。

column2: Pay the bill.
column3: 买单

column2:
It's a hefty price for a plate, but the brickload of food in your stomach will definitely last a while.

Plus, there aren't a lot of chickens running around out in the wilderness, let alone deep-fryers. Must be some sort of vertical farm around here. No room for anything but.

You pay for the meal, then a thought occurs to you. "Do people still tip?"
column3: 虽然这顿餐的价格不菲，但是成堆的食物在你肚子里面至少还能饱腹一段时间。话说，在荒野中没有太多的鸡，更不用说油炸食品了。这里一定有某种垂直农场。除了。你付了饭钱，然后突然想到：人们还会给小费吗？"人们还会给小费吗？"

column2: Exiled from DMC - Discharge
column3: 被底特律流放 - 释放

column2:
The voice continues, "You are hereby discharged from DMC Gate 11, marked and exiled for a period of 1 year. Failure to comply with this sentence is cause for appended term of exile not to exceed 2 years per infraction."

A door on the opposite wall buzzes, and swings open, blinding you temporarily with the light from outside.

When your eyes finally adjust, you see the cold, muddy streets outside the DMC walls, and the huddling throngs of Sprawl inhabitants going about their business.
column3: 声音接着说道, "特此将你从底特律 11 号门释放, 并被标记和流放1年。如果不遵守本判决，将被追加流放期限，每次违规不超过2年。"墙对面上的一扇门嗡嗡作响，然后打开了，外面的光线使你暂时失明。当你的眼睛终于适应后，你看到底特律外墙寒冷且泥泞的街道，还有挤在一块的延展区居民们在忙着他们的事情。

column2: Haggerty Health Clinic
column3: 哈格蒂健康中心

column2:
Haggerty Health Clinic is a pretty busy spot. Its proximity to major transportation arteries, and its mercenary attitude toward clientele, ensures that it has a steady stream of business, from both inside the DMC and Sprawl.

The "Double H", as it's often called, offers a wide spectrum of health services. Those include diagnostics, cleaning and dressing of wounds, therapeutics (including nanorobotic suspension treatments), and prescription drugs.

There is also an on-site augmentation clinic, where patients can elect for prosthetic enhancements. These highly desired services may require special permits, in addition to the significant price tags.
column3: 哈格蒂健康中心是一个相当繁忙的地方。它靠近主要的交通干线，并对客户采取唯利是图的态度，以确保它能够从底特律大都市内部和延伸区中获得稳定的业务。人们常说的 "Double H" 指的就是广泛的卫生服务。包括诊断，伤口清洁和敷料，治疗（包括纳米机器人悬浮治疗）和处方药。还有一个现场增强诊所，患者可以选择假肢增强。除了高昂的价格之外，这些非常受欢迎的服务可能还需要其他的特别许可。

column2: Haggerty Health Clinic
column3: 哈格蒂健康中心

column2: "What services do you require today?"
column3: "您今天需要什么服务？"

column2: PharmaCon Prescription Sedatives x6 - $120
column3: PharmaCon 处方镇静剂 x6 - $120

column2:
Patient will receive 6 doses of prescription sleeping pills.

Cost: $120
column3: 患者将接受 6 个剂量的处方安眠药。 花费:$120

column2: Haggerty Health Clinic
column3: 哈格蒂健康中心

column2: "Is there anything else we can help you with?"
column3: "还有什么我们可以帮助到您的吗？"

column2: Order the nanorobotic suspension.
column3: 订购纳米机器人悬架。

column2:
Though one of the simpler processes offered by the clinic, it remains one of the most requested, and takes place in a larger room with many other patients receiving the same service.

You're sat in a chair, similar to those used in blood donations, and an IV is inserted into your arm. The suspension takes a while to be absorbed, but once done, technicians verify that the body has begun processing it, and the nanorobots are active.

Satisfied, the technician directs you to an attendant, who then processes the order.
column3: 虽然这是诊所提供的更简单的过程之一，但它仍然是最受欢迎的过程之一，并且在一个更大的房间里进行，许多其他患者接受同样的服务。你坐在椅子上，类似于献血时使用的椅子，静脉注射被插入你的手臂。悬浮液需要一段时间才能被吸收，但一旦完成，技术人员就会验证身体已经开始处理它，并且纳米机器人是活跃的。满意后，技术人员会将您引向服务员，然后服务员会处理订单。

column2: Order the telescopic eye upgrade.
column3: 进行鹰眼升级

column2:
For the upgrade, you're led to a fitting room, where you sit upright as a technician prepares the materials.

He unlocks a glass display case, and removes a white retail box. Inside are two replacement lenses, consisting of the frontal sclera and adjustable lens components.

Due to the fact that the eye will be unsealed during the procedure, you're subjected to local anesthesia for the procedure. It's relatively quick, however, as it's just a swapping out of parts while your eyes are fixed forward.
column3: 为了升级，你被领到一个配件室。你在那里直直地坐着，一个技术员正在准备材料。他打开一个玻璃展示柜，取出一个白色零售盒。里面有两块替换镜片，包括正面巩膜和可调节的镜片部件。由于手术过程中眼部将被打开，因此你将接受局部麻醉。不过，这还是比较快的，因为它只是在你眼睛固定朝前时更换一些零件。

column2: Order the eye surgery.
column3: 进行眼部手术

column2:
After screening you for existing factors and eligibility, your vision is assessed by computer, and you're guided to an operating room.

The procedure is quick, and done in under local anesthesia. Within an hour, you are back on your feet. You're told that you may experience some dryness in your eyes or mild pain, but the healing period is only a remarkable 1-2 days.

Finished, you make your way to the attendant to retrieve your belongings.
column3: 在对你的现有因素和资格进行筛选后，你的视力将由电脑评估，然后你将被引导到一个手术室。在局部麻醉下的手术很快就完成了。一个小时之内，你便重新站了起来。你被告知你可能会感到眼睛有些干燥或轻微疼痛，但恢复期只需要 1-2 天。手术结束后，你走向服务人员取回了自己的东西。

column2: Order the eye replacement.
column3: 进行眼球替换

column2:
After verifying there is no danger of synthetic rejection, you're escorted to an operating room, given fluid and nutrient IV insertions, and placed under local anesthesia.

The procedure is lengthy and extremely complex, requiring precise manipulation of tissue at a micro scale. Much of the work is done via a computer-aided telesurgery armature.

When finished, there's a brilliant flash of geometry and patterns as the photoreceptors are activated. For several minutes, your vision passes in and out of focus, shifts colors, and goes black again as the devices are calibrated. You feel some anxiety at the lack of control.

Finally, it stabilizes in a hyperfocused, almost unsettlingly crisp image, and your eyes begin their usual movements. 

You can see again.
column3: 在确认没有合成排斥的危险后，你会被护送到手术室，插入液体和营养液，并接受局部麻醉。手术过程是漫长而又极其复杂的，需要在微观尺度上对人体组织进行精确的操作。大部分工作是通过计算机辅助的远程手术臂完成的。完成后，当光感受器被激活时，你感觉眼前闪过纷杂的几何形体和图案。在几分钟内，你的视线在焦点中来回穿梭，变换颜色，在设备被校准时又变成黑色。并对缺乏控制而感到有些焦虑。最后，它稳定在一个高度聚焦的、几乎令人不安的清晰图像中，你的眼睛开始正常转动。你又能看见了。

column2: Order the night vision eye upgrade.
column3: 进行夜视眼升级

column2:
For the upgrade, you're led to a fitting room, where you sit upright as a technician prepares the materials.

He unlocks a glass display case, and removes a small dustproof tray lined with foam. Inside are two metallic cylinders, which he removes and prepares to install.

The procedure is a bit uncomfortable, as the technician has to handle your artificial eye to insert the upgrade. However, it's fairly quick, and the lack of pain receptors on the artificial eyes means the sensation is mainly limited to pressure in the eye sockets.
column3: 为了升级，你被领到一个配件室。你在那里直直地坐着，一个技术员正在准备材料。他打开一个玻璃展示柜，取出一个衬有泡沫的小型防尘托盘。里面有两个金属圆柱体，他将其取出并准备安装。这个过程有点不舒服，因为技术员必须处理你的人造眼睛来插入升级。然而，过程也是相当快的，而且人造眼睛上缺乏疼痛感受器，这意味着你的不适感局限于眼窝内的压力。

column2: Upstairs to Prosthetic and Augmentation Procedures
column3: 走往楼上的假肢和增强手术部门

column2:
You begin speaking with an attendant, who reviews your eligibility test results.

Fortunately, initial testing seems to indicate that you are eligible for further augmentation and prosthesis.

You are given a catalog of procedures currently offered by Haggerty.
column3: 你开始与一名服务员交谈，他审查了你的资格测试结果。幸运的是，初步测试似乎表明你有资格接受进一步的人体增强和假肢改造手术。你得到了一份哈格蒂目前提供的人体改造手术目录。

column2: Artificial Eye Night Vision Upgrade - $2300
column3: 人造眼球夜视升级 - $2300

column2:
Patients who have already received the RA:037 Human Eye replacement can have their units upgraded with the Rose Augmentations RA:056 Low Light photoreceptors, which provide normal vision in low-light conditions.

The procedure is fast and simple, requiring only that the additional hardware be installed in the existing units.

Cost: $2300
column3: 已经接受了 RA:037 人眼替代物植入的话，可以用 Rose Augmentations RA:056 低光感光器对他们的装置进行升级，它可以在低光条件下提供正常视力。整个过程快速而又简单，只需要在现有的装置中安装额外的硬件。 花费:$2300

column2: Artificial Eye Telescopic Upgrade - $2200
column3: 人造眼鹰眼升级 - $2200

column2:
Patients who have already received the RA:037 Human Eye replacement can have their units upgraded with the Rose Augmentations RA:043 Optical Zoom, which increases their visual range.

The procedure is relatively simple, requiring only that the additional hardware be installed in the existing units.

Cost: $2200
column3: 已经接受了 RA:037 人眼替代物植入的话，可以使用 Rose Augmentations RA:043 光学变焦升级他们的装置，从而增加他们的视觉范围。整个过程相对简单，只需要将额外的硬件安装到现有的装置上。 花费:$2200

column2: Cross the Lobby cont'd
column3: 穿过大厅续

column2:
You vividly recall the alpha male sinking his fangs deep into the neck of the mammoth. Working his big jaw from side to side until blood gushed in a torrential outpouring straight towards the camera. 

You bolt for the door, hurling yourself through, slamming it shut behind. In all the excitement you trip and end up in an ungainly heap on the floor.
column3: 你清楚地记得雄性首领把他的尖牙深深地咬进猛犸象的脖子。他的大下巴左右摆动，直到鲜血如洪流般直奔镜头。你冲向门，冲了进去，砰的一声关上了门。在所有的兴奋中，你绊倒了，最终笨拙地倒在地板上。

column2: Inside the Fairgrounds, Hub
column3: 游乐场内，中心

column2: No telling when that rooster will make his move, so you probably shouldn't tarry here long.
column3: 天知道那公鸡啥时候会动起来,所以你最好别在这里逗留太久。

column2: "Genuine Indian Artifacts!" cont'd
column3: "货真价实的印第安文物!" 续

column2:
The wrapping paper appears to be a photocopy of a museum brochure, depicting the same, or a very similar, string of beads. The brochure has the following text on it:

"Ziibiwing Center, Anishinabe Tribal Nation, MI"

Looks like someone was doing a little bit of black marketeering in historic artifacts.

Conveniently, the photocopied brochure has driving directions to the Anishinabe Tribal Nation, and Ziibiwing Center, near old Mt. Pleasant, MI.
column3: 包装纸似乎是一份博物馆宣传册的复印件，上面描绘的是相同或非常相似的一串珠子。小册子上有以下文字："Ziibiwing 中心, Anishinabe 部落民族, 密歇根州" 看起来有人在黑市上销售历史文物。方便的是，复印的手册中包含着前往 Anishinabe 部落民族和 Ziibiwing 中心的方向。

column2: Pry open the roof!
column3: 撬开屋顶!

column2:
Good thing you packed for the trip.

Hoisting your prying tool up, you precariously balance on feet and one handhold while you wrench it into a roof panel. There are some awful metallic creaking noises as flimsy metal bends and strains.
column3: 好在你为这次旅行做了准备。你举起撬棍，用一只脚和一只手勉强保持着平衡，同时将撬棍猛力插入屋顶板。随着脆弱的金属弯曲和变形，发出了一些令人难以忍受的金属咔哒声。

column2: Return to Zom Zom's
column3: 回到僵僵食堂

column2:
Zom Zom's.

Home of angry mobs, loud music, the human rendering pit, and questionably sourced barbecue. It was a narrow escape that delivered you from this place before, but now you're back.

Why are you back, exactly?
column3: 僵僵食堂。愤怒的暴徒、嘈杂的音乐、人类的竞技坑，以及来源可疑的烤肉之家。以前你从这个地方逃了出去，但现在你又回来了。你为什么回来，说真的？

column2: Inside Zom Zom's Again
column3: 再次进入僵僵食堂

column2:
It's busy, as usual. Whether starved for nourishment or entertainment, it's depressing what people will do to fill that hunger.
		
You check the counter and see a board with only two items marked, barbecue for 4 bucks or a beer for 8 bucks. There's a lot of people around the counter, so it's not even worth the effort to go there if there's no money in your pockets.
column3: 这里总是很繁忙，和往常一样。不管是因为饥饿还是寻求娱乐，人们总是想方设法填补饥饿。你检查了一下柜台，发现上面只标记了两样东西，一份烤肉售价4美元，一瓶啤酒售价8美元。柜台周围有很多人，如果你身上没有钱，根本不值得去那里。

column2: Grab some barbecue
column3: 抓一些烤肉

column2:
It's half the reason anyone comes here. Might as well score a skewer or two.

You squeeze yourself up to the counter, and do your best to out-wave, out-glance, and outmaneuver the dirty masses around you.

Minutes later, you sidestep back into the crowd, eating your prize in a guarded hunch.
column3: 这可能是人们来这里的一半原因。还不如吃一两串。你挤到柜台前，尽你最大的努力去挥手并避开你周围的肮脏人群。几分钟后，你侧身回到人群中，以警惕的驼背姿势享受着自己的战利品。

column2: What next?
column3: 接下来是什么?

column2: It'll be a couple minutes as they prep the arena. What next?
column3: 他们收拾竞技场估计需要几分钟。接下来是什么?

column2: Locked!
column3: 锁上了！

column2:
Sweaty palms grasp at the door handle and madly yank at it.

It's locked!

What feels like a subcompact slams you half into the door, and half into its adjoining wall. Both you and tiger bounce back a little, and land on hard, wet floor.

As the tiger rights itself, you scramble forward on hands and feet towards the exit, screaming through the pain.
column3: 出汗的手掌抓住门把手，疯狂地猛拉。门是锁着的。感觉就像一辆微型汽车把你一半撞到门上，一半撞到相邻的墙上。你和老虎都反弹了一点，落在坚硬潮湿的地板上。当老虎权利本身时，你手脚并用地向出口爬去，痛苦地尖叫着。

column2: Locked cont'd
column3: 锁定续

column2:
Falling through, you kick out wildly, and the door slams shut just as the sabre-toothed tiger crashes into it.

Panting, gasping, you concentrate on staying still and calming your racing heartbeat.

It doesn't seem to be coming after you.

Still, better put some distance in, just in case.
column3: 掉了进去，你疯狂地踢了出去，门砰的一声关上了，就在剑齿虎撞上的时候。气喘吁吁，喘气，你集中精力保持静止，平静你的心跳。它似乎不是来找你的。不过，最好还是保持一定距离，以防万一。

column2: Return to Isotope Mine
column3: 返回同位素矿

column2:
You've returned to the mini trash alley that leads to the Isotope Mine.

It doesn't look like anyone's home, though. Or at least, like anyone wants visitors. And you're not keen enough on getting raked by gore-infected claws to knock.
column3: 你回到了通往同位素矿的迷你垃圾巷。不过，这看起来不像是任何人的家。或者至少，就像任何人都想要访客一样。你也不会热衷于被沾满鲜血的爪子抓来敲门。

column2: Locked!
column3: 锁上了！

column2:
Sweaty palms grasp at the door handle and madly yank at it.

It's locked!

You immediately sidestep, narrowly avoiding a heap of fur and bone as it careens into the wall where you just were. You push off the wall, out into the air, acting purely on adrenaline.
column3: 出汗的手掌抓住门把手，疯狂地猛拉。门是锁着的。你立即闪开，险些避开一堆毛皮和骨头，因为它撞上了你刚才所在的墙上。你推下墙壁，飞到空中，纯粹是靠肾上腺素。

column2: That door lamp looks wrong...
column3: 那个门灯看起来不对劲...

column2:
There's something wrong with the way that door is lit. In fact, even the conduits seem out of place there.

It looks more like an interior bulkhead than an exterior door.

Sure, it'd hold up okay out here a while. But nobody'd build 'em like that on purpose.

There's a good chance you're actually standing in what used to be a basement, not a ravine.
column3: 那扇门的照明方式有问题。事实上，就连管道也显得格格不入。它看起来更像一个内部舱壁，而不是一个外门。当然，在这里能撑一段时间。但没人会故意把它们造成那样。很有可能你真的站在曾经是地下室的地方，而不是峡谷。

column2: Leave the Isotope Mine.
column3: 离开同位素矿。

column2: That's enough dallying in a trash-laden killzone for one day. Off you go.
column3: 在满是垃圾的杀戮地带消磨一天已经够了。你走吧。

column2: Pry the lid open.
column3: 撬开盖子

column2:
Fortunately, you have a tool for this purpose.

Threading the prying tool through one of the rusted loops of metal, you position yourself to maximize your leverage, and pry.

At first, it doesn't seem like anything's going to happen. But the lid finally budges, and strands of grass tear as the lid swings open.
column3: 幸运的是，你有一个专门用于这个目的的工具。将撬动工具穿过一个生锈的金属环，你摆好位置，以最大限度地发挥杠杆作用，然后撬开。起初，似乎什么都没发生。过了一会儿，盖子终于有了动静，当盖子摇晃着打开时，几缕缠绕着的野草被撕裂了。

column2: Leave the area.
column3: 离开该地区。

column2: You decide to leave things alone here, for now.
column3: 你决定暂时别管这里的事情。

column2: Grab the ladder!
column3: 抓住梯子！

column2:
You opt for safety, and grab hold of the ladder again. One of the catwalk's moorings pulls free from the wall with a spout of concrete dust, and the walkway swings downward violently, smashing against a pipe.

With nowhere to go but up, you start climbing, and emerge on the surface again.

Whatever awaits down there will have to wait for someone better prepared.

Or suicidal.
column3: 你选择安全，再次抓住梯子。一个舷梯的系泊装置随着一股混凝土灰尘从墙上脱落，走道猛烈地向下摆动，撞到了一根管道。除了向上无处可去，你开始攀登，并再次浮出水面。无论下面等待着什么，都必须等待准备更充分的人。或者自杀。

column2: Jump Success, Lose Right Hand Item
column3: 跳转成功，失去右手物品

column2:
The rung hits your hand before you see it in this darkness, and you scramble to grab on before it slips away.

You lose your grip on what you were holding, though.

Pulling with desperation, you manage to hook an elbow over the rung, and catch your breath.

The sounds of dislodged concrete clang from below, disturbed by your jump.

You throw your free arm upward to the next rung, and pull with both arms to get a knee up. And then, it's just a ladder.

You slow your breathing, concentrate on not slipping, and climb back to the surface.

The outside world seems loud and windy by comparison. 

But also safe.
column3: 在黑暗中，你还没看到横档就撞到了你的手，你就在它溜走之前争先恐后地抓住它。然而，你失去了对你所持有的东西的控制。绝望地拉着，你设法把一只胳膊肘钩在横档上，然后屏住呼吸。被你的跳跃打断的混凝土从下面发出的铿锵声。你把你的自由手臂向上扔到下一个横档，用双臂拉，让一个膝盖向上。然后，它只是一个梯子。你放慢呼吸，集中精力不滑倒，爬回水面。相比之下，外面的世界显得喧闹多风。但也很安全。

column2: Jump Success, Lose Left Hand Item
column3: 跳转成功，失去左手物品

column2:
The rung hits your hand before you see it in this darkness, and you scramble to grab on before it slips away.

You lose your grip on what you were holding, though.

Pulling with desperation, you manage to hook an elbow over the rung, and catch your breath.

The sounds of dislodged concrete clang from below, disturbed by your jump.

You throw your free arm upward to the next rung, and pull with both arms to get a knee up. And then, it's just a ladder.

You slow your breathing, concentrate on not slipping, and climb back to the surface.

The outside world seems loud and windy by comparison. 

But also safe.

column3: 返回同位素矿梯

column2: Cross the Lobby cont'd
column3: 穿过大厅续

column2:
You vividly recall the alpha male sinking his fangs deep into the neck of the mammoth. Working his big jaw from side to side until blood gushed in a torrential outpouring straight towards the camera. 

Backing away slowly, so as not to disturb its... whatever it's doing, you step back outside.

You're careful not to lose sight of that doorway until you're clear of the entrance.
column3: 你清楚地记得雄性首领把他的尖牙深深地咬进猛犸象的脖子。他的大下巴左右摆动，直到鲜血如洪流般直奔镜头。慢慢后退，以免打扰它的...不管它在做什么，你都退到外面去。在你离开入口之前，你要小心不要看不见那扇门。

column3: 运行软件

column2:
Not enough charge left in the laptop.

You start up the application, but before long, it becomes clear that the algorithm could run as long as half an hour, and you'll need at least that much charge in the laptop to complete the process.
column3: 笔记本电脑中剩余的电量不足。你启动了应用程序，但没过多久，你就会发现，这个算法可能会运行半小时之久，而你至少需要笔记本里有这么多电才能完成这个过程。

Welcome to NanoSoft Home!

column3: 欢迎访问NanoSoft首页!请从下面的列表中选择所需的操作。

column2: Booth Empty
column3: 空亭子

column2: You're outside the DSB Gate 11 microbranch, now empty and locked.
column3: 你在 DSB 11号微型支行的外面，现在那里已经空无一人，并且锁上了。

column2: Pick the booth's lock.
column3: 撬开亭子的锁。

column2:
Under normal circumstances, picking a lock in plain view on some busy sidewalk is a dumb move.

Under these circumstances, it still is. You work your magic on the lock, but by the time you're seated at the terminal, someone outside is already on their mobile. Probably talking to the police.

There's no sign of the teller yet, but you're betting your time here is limited.

Damn that good Samaritan.
column3: 在正常情况下，明目张胆地在繁忙的人行道上撬锁是一种愚蠢的举动。在这种情况下，依然是。你对锁进行了一番操作，但当你坐在终端前时，外面有人已经在打手机。可能是在和警方通话。目前还没有出纳员的踪迹，但你打赌你在这里的时间不多了。真是该死的好心人。

column2: Wait for the teller to leave.
column3: 等待出纳员离开。

column2:
You find a position with a good vantage point, and stare at the booth like a psycho for a while.

The booth doesn't garner a lot of foot traffic, which might explain why there are so few of them around town.

As you're waiting, you think she spots you, but you can't be sure. Waiting a bit longer, she starts talking on her mobile, and glances your way, looking down again when she sees you.

It appears you've been made.

As you hurry down the sidewalk, faint sirens can be heard echoing through the canyon of skyscrapers.
column3: 你找了个有利的位置，像个神经病一样盯着亭子看了一会儿。这个亭子的人流量并不大，这也许可以解释为什么城里很少有这样的亭子。在等待的过程中，你觉得她发现了你，但你不能确定。又等了一会儿，她开始用手机通话，并向你这边瞥了一眼，看到你后又低下了头。看来你已经被发现了。当你匆匆走在人行道上时，微弱的警笛声在摩天大楼的峡谷中回荡。

column2: Teller Flees, Calls Police
column3: 出纳员逃走并报警

column2: You've got access to the computer now, but not much time. The threatening of a bank employee is sure to be high on the police priority list.
column3: 你现在可以访问电脑了，但时间不多了。威胁银行员工的行为肯定会被警方列为优先处理事项。

column2: Your Confiscated Items
column3: 你被没收的物品

column2:
You are taken to collect your things. "Don't forget anything. Abandoned items will be destroyed," the guard warns.

Better make sure you empty that locker while you have the chance.
column3: 你被带去取你的东西。"别忘记任何东西，遗弃的物品将被销毁。"警卫警告说。最好确保在有机会的时候清空你的储物柜。

column2: Run away from the skybike!
column3: 逃离天空摩托！

column2:
You steel your nerves, and bolt, veering left immediately.

A flash of red emits from the skybike's undercarriage, and your body is painted in a flickering cross-hatched pattern.

You hear a beep, followed by a loud "pow!"

Something slams into you, and you collapse instantly, muscles seizing uncontrollably. Unable to move, see, or even hear straight, the world is an agonizing blur as you flop on the asphalt.
column3: 你绷紧神经，立即向左猛冲。天空摩托车的底部闪出一道红光，你的身体被一个闪烁的交叉图案笼罩。你听到一声哔哔声，然后是巨大的 "砰！"声。 有东西猛地撞向你，你瞬间倒下，肌肉不受控制地抽搐起来。你无法动弹，无法看清东西，甚至无法听到声音，当你倒在沥青路面上时，整个世界都变得模糊不清。

column2: Sprint away from the skybike!
column3: 从天空摩托旁飞奔而去！

column2:
You steel your nerves, and bolt, veering left immediately.

A flash of red emits from the skybike's undercarriage, and your body is painted in a flickering cross-hatched pattern.

You hear the engines change pitch as the vehicle reorients, a beep, followed by a loud "pow!"

Something smacks against the ground near your feet, flashing arcs of electricity as it skitters.
column3: 你绷紧神经，立即向左猛冲。天空摩托车的底部闪出一道红光，你的身体被一个闪烁的交叉图案笼罩。你听到发动机的声音变调，车辆重新调整方向，接着是一声哔哔声，随后是巨大的 "砰！"声。 有东西砸在你脚边的地面上，闪烁着电弧。

column2: DMC Questioning Return
column3: 底特律问询 返回

column2:
Well, this is familiar. You're back in the beige fortress, awaiting processing by DMC Perimeter Services.

Same old ceiling tiles. Same old filing cabinets. Same old missing persons...
column3: 好吧，这很熟悉。你又回到了米黄色的堡垒中，等待着底特律周边服务的处理。同样的天花板格子。同样的旧文件柜。同样的失踪人口...

column2: Exiled from DMC
column3: 被底特律流放

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-First-degree criminal trespassing
-Unauthorized access to a computer with intent to commit an offense
-Fraud and misuse of visas
-Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit
-Consorting with a known felon
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的哔哔声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。"你被指控以下罪名： -一级非法入侵罪 -未经授权访问计算机，意图犯罪 -欺诈和滥用签证 -密谋欺骗底特律市 -与已知重罪犯勾结 -未披露个人信息"

column2: DMC Questioning - Exile I to II
column3: 底特律问询 - 流放 I 到 II

column2:
This time, when the case handler arrives, there's no talking. Just scribbling notes, cross-checking a nearby monitor, and a stern glance telling you you're not worth the effort.

A guard grabs your shoulder, and pushes you into the cinder block room with the blaring speakerphone.

A voice blares, "Repeated violation of exile order is cause for term of sentence to be extended by 2 years. Subsequent violations may be subject to penalties including capital punishment, at the discretion of the arresting officer."

A door on the opposite wall buzzes, and swings open to the familiar muddy streets outside the DMC walls.
column3: 这一次，当办案人员到达时，没有交流。只有潦草的笔记，检查附近的监视器，以及使用一个严厉的凝视告诉你不值得去做。一名警卫抓住你的肩膀并将你推进水泥砖砌成的房间，里面的扬声器滋滋作响。一个声音喊道, "屡次违反流放令将延长2年刑期。之后的违规行为可能导致刑罚，包括死刑，由拘捕人员酌情决定。"对面墙上的一扇门嗡嗡作响，然后打开了，那是底特律墙外熟悉的泥泞街道。

column2: Denied Entry - Stolen Pass
column3: 拒绝入境 - 被盗的通行证

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAB11324 Authorized."

You wait for them to let you pass but the guard speaks something to his comms. Another guard arrives and places a heavy-gloved hand on your shoulder. "Alright, buddy, let's go."

You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。一阵啁啾声打破了意味深长的沉默, 同时显示屏开始刷新。"访客通行证 N6MAA10816 嫌疑人被标记：拘留审讯。" 你的肚子突然像被真空吸住了。警卫用穿着厚手套的手放在你的肩膀上。“好了，老兄，我们走吧。你被带到据点南部扶壁下的一扇灰色门前，旁边是一扇窄面窗户。

column2: Run away from the skybike!
column3: 逃离天空摩托！

column2:
You steel your nerves, and bolt, veering left immediately.

A flash of red emits from the skybike's undercarriage, and your body is painted in a flickering cross-hatched pattern.

You hear a beep, followed by a loud "pow!"

Something slams into you, and you stagger a few steps as muscles clench near the impact.
column3: 你绷紧神经，立即向左猛冲。天空摩托车的底部闪出一道红光，你的身体被一个闪烁的交叉图案笼罩。你听到一声哔哔声，接着是一声巨响 "砰！"什么东西撞击了你，你踉跄着退了几步，感到肌肉在撞击附近紧绷。

column2: Run underneath the skybike!
column3: 从天空摩托下面跑过去！

column2:
You steel your nerves, and bolt, charging directly under the skybike.

A flash of red emits from its undercarriage, and your body is painted in a flickering cross-hatched pattern.

You hear the engines change pitch as the vehicle reorients, a beep, followed by a loud "pow!"

Something smacks against the ground near your feet, flashing arcs of electricity as it skitters.
column3: 你绷紧神经，猛地一跃，直接冲到了天空摩托的下方。飞天摩托车的底部闪出一道红光，你的身体被一个闪烁的交叉图案笼罩。你听到发动机的声音变调，车辆重新调整方向，接着是一声哔哔声，随后是巨大的 "砰！"声。 有东西砸在你脚边的地面上，闪烁着电弧。

column2: Watch the teller log in.
column3: 观察出纳员登录。

column2:
Positioning yourself for optimal viewing, you await the teller's login.

However, a shout startles you out of your vigil. The technician's checklist goes on hold as she notices your staring, and starts speaking into her earpiece.

The teller's been alerted, too, and is standing up.

Things are about to get pretty hot here. Time to jet.
column3: 你调整好自己的位置，等待出纳员的登录。然而，一声喊叫打断了你的监视。技术人员注意到了你的凝视，开始对着耳麦说话，核对清单也随之暂停。出纳员也被惊动了，站了起来。情况很快会变得相当紧张。是时候离开了。

column2: Human Meat Peddler
column3: 人肉贩子

column2:
As you turn to leave the market, you hear a bell ringing, its clanging reverberating through the honeycomb of shipping containers. You soon see angry sprawlers marching your way. You recognize one of them, the butcher that was buying meat. He heads towards you, scattergun in hand.

Everyone else stops, turning. Craning their necks to see around the crowd at the commotion.

"Flesh peddler!" he shouts. "Cannibal!"
column3: 当你转身离开市场时，你听到了铃声，它的铛铛声在蜂窝状的集装箱中回荡。你很快看到了愤怒的人们朝着你走来。你认出了其中一个，就是那个买肉的屠夫。他朝你走来，手里拿着散弹枪。其他人都停了下来，转过身。伸长他们的脖子去看周围人群的骚动。"肉贩子!" 他大喊着。"食人族!"

column2: The Great Black Swamp cont'd
column3: 大黑沼泽 续

column2:
And the silence here is deafening. No birds, nor critters. Not even insects. Nothing stirs in this caustic swamp of destruction.

Nothing lives here.

Or at least, nothing should.
column3: 这里的寂静令人无法承受。没有鸟，也没有动物。连昆虫都没有。没有什么东西能够惊扰到这片能毁灭一切的腐蚀性沼泽。没有什么居住在这里。或者说, 没什么能在这里活下来的。

column2: Human Meat Peddler: Second Offense
column3: 人肉贩子：二次触犯

column2:
"Hey!" a voice booms. The butcher's voice.

"Didn't I tell you?" The market quiets to a murmur.

"I done told you, didn't I?" He points his knife at you. "I ever see you and human meat together, under this roof..." and he draws the knife across his neck, in a cutting motion.
column3: "嘿!" 一声响起.屠夫的声音."我没跟你说过么?"市场静悄悄的。"我跟你说过吧, 是吧?"他用刀指着你。"我要是再看见你和人肉一起在这里出现..." 然后他用刀横在脖子前, 作出了一个切割的动作。

column2: Ask about the power cell.
column3: 询问动力电池。

column2:
"Oh," he says, distracted. Then, he becomes more animated. 

"Oh! Ya mean the hot bricks! Sure! Sure. Think I've got a spare 'round here..." Boxes are pushed about. Papers displaced.

"Whatchu got ta offer?"
column3: “哦，”他心不在焉地说。然后，他变得更加活跃。“哦！你是说热砖！肯定！肯定。我想我这里有一个备用的……”箱子被推来推去。文件移位。“你得到了什么提议？”

column2: Help Gerty?
column3: 帮格蒂？

column2:
Turning back to you, he asks, "How about ol' Gerty. Think ya can help 'er?"

He adds, "Be a reeal help, you know?"
column3: 他转向你，问道：“老格蒂怎么样？你觉得你能帮上忙吗？”他补充道，“做一个真正的帮手，你知道吗？”

column2: Activate the mechanical doll.
column3: 启动机械玩偶。

column2:
Well, you've got this...thing. It's a long shot, but maybe it'd draw that bike's attention?

You locate a crude power switch, take a deep breath, and flip...
column3: 嗯，你有这个......东西。虽然机会渺茫，但也许能吸引那辆车的注意？你找到一个简陋的电源开关，深吸一口气，然后打开...

column2: Eating the Donner
column3: 吃唐纳

column2:
The meat has a powerful, mostly pleasant taste. Combined with the sauces, it's spicy, salty, and sweet. Probably engineered that way.

And the texture is homogenous and unoffensive. No fibers, fats, nor bone.

Though after a few bites, you can see where the veggies come in. Roughage, something to chew on, and actual nutrients are not amiss here.

Still, it helps fill the pit inside, and you can see how this might become a habit for locals.
column3: 这肉有着浓郁且愉悦的味道。调了酱料之后, 吃起来又辣又咸而且还甜，可能就是这样设计的。可能是这样设计的。而且质地均匀，不会令人讨厌。没有纤维、脂肪，也没有骨头。虽然咬了几口后，你可以看到蔬菜出现了。粗粮、可供咀嚼的东西和实际的营养物质在这里都不错。尽管如此，它可以填补你肚子里面的空虚，你可以看到这可能已经成为了当地人的一种习惯。

column2: Eating the Fingers
column3: 吃指头

column2:
A crispy, salty-sour shell gives way to a softer, more flavor-neutral center. It's a pleasant sensation, the initial flavor and crunch.

However, the plate is gone almost too soon, and you're left feeling about as satisfied as if you'd eaten the equivalent volume of cheese puffs.

At least this was healthier.
column3: 这道菜的外壳是脆的，咸酸味十足，中间部分质地柔软，味道更淡。那原始的风味和嘎吱嘎吱的口感让人感到非常愉悦。然而，盘子里的东西几乎一下子就被吃光了，你就像吃了同等体积的奶酪泡芙一样感到满足。至少这盘菜更加健康。

column2: Eating the Roast
column3: 吃烤肉

column2:
The roast isn't bad, in fact. Gamey, to be sure. And a bit milder than the stuff one finds "out there".

There's some stringiness and gristle to it, too. Less desirable in days past, but proof you have actual meat in this case. Meat of what, you're probably better off not knowing.

The cabbage is actually a nice touch, despite its rank among cheap nutrients. Fresh-cooked veggies are not common fare these days.

You gulp down the last bites, and get your bearings again.
column3: 事实上，这烤肉还不错。可以肯定的是，味道确实足。而且也没有在"外面"找到的那些东西一样重口味。这肉也既有筋也有脆骨。虽然不太符合你过去这些天日思夜想的东西, 但至少你也算能吃到真正的肉。至于这到底是什么肉，你最好还是不要知道。卷心菜在这里真是点睛之笔，尽管它的营养物质不算多，但新鲜烹调的蔬菜在这些日子里并不常见。如今，新鲜烹饪的蔬菜并不常见。你吞下最后一口，并再次确定你的方向。

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-First-degree criminal trespassing
-Unauthorized access to a computer with intent to commit an offense
-Fraud and misuse of visas
-Conspiracy to defraud the city of Detroit
-Consorting with a known felon
-Failure to disclose personal information"

"There are some religious loonies who call themselves Blue Frogs. Just stay away from them is all I can say. There are also tribals but if you see those then that means you are too far from the DMC. Then there is this group that call themselves Martha's Army. They seem to enjoy smashing electronics. Bad Muthas are the worst of 'em. Damn cannibals, you ask me. We get some Butcher Boys, too."

Looking back at you, "You just keep close to town, though, and you're better off."

column2: Reaching Destination
column3: 抵达目的地

column2:
Minutes of silent traveling later, you begin to hear sounds. Not forest sounds, but people sounds. Tools being worked. A crack from a fire.

Voices startle you from your strained listening. Your captors are talking, but not in English. Not in anything you recognize.

One of them calls out, and a distant voice responds. It sounds like you're entering a camp of some kind. You smell wood burning. Your arrival causes a stir, and you stop moving for a moment.

More talking.
column3: 几分钟悄无声息的旅程之后，你开始听到了声音，不是树林的声音，而是人们的声音，有人在用工具，还有火焰的劈啪声。不是森林的声音，而是人的声音。正在加工的工具。人声惊到了你紧绷的耳朵，抓住你的人在说话，但是说的话不是英语，也不是你所知的语言。声音把你从紧张的倾听中吓了一跳。抓你的人在说话，但不是用英语。不是你认识的任何东西。听起来你好像进入一个营地。你闻到木头烧焦的味道。你闻到木头燃烧的味道。你的到来引起了人们的骚动，你感到停了下来。说话的人更多了。

column2: Rehab
column3: 康复治疗

column2:
Your hunger sated, you lean back in the warmth of the room. The scent of dinner mingles with cedar and tobacco.

Despite the weight in your stomach, there is a sense of unrest within you.

Anxiety is pulling you toward the door. A fear is trying to convince you that every moment in here is threatening your existence.

But there is a part of you wanting to stay. Instinct is holding you fast.

You're not sure whether laziness and contentedness is putting you in danger, or if addiction is dragging you away from recovery.
column3: 你吃饱了，享受着屋子的温暖。晚餐的香味与雪松和烟草的味道相得益彰。尽管你的肚子很饱，但你内心有一种不安的感觉。焦虑把你拉向门口。内心的焦虑让你向门口走去，恐惧正让你感觉到在这里多呆一秒都是对你的威胁。但是另一个你却想让你呆在这里，本能让你克制住了自己。本能紧紧抓住你。你不确定是懒惰和满足让你处于危险之中，还是那上瘾的感觉阻止着你的恢复。

Further away, you see a cluster of huts near a sweat lodge, where Joe, the Nooke Midewinini, tends to the sick and wounded.

"You should speak with Michelle Lavallee, our Ajijaak elder. She is interested in these things, and knows a lot about them."

"Just be respectful," she warns. "Our warriors are accustomed to troublemakers entering our lands."

column2: Browse the trading post.
column3: 浏览交易站的物品

column2:
The trading post seems to be a place where travelers resupply and offload items which may be of use to the Anishinaabe.

The goods inside the hut seem to be mostly food and items sold in bulk. It looks more like a storage area than a general store.

The trader outside the hut offers a variety of goods. A large portion of the inventory appears to be handmade items from local materials, and some scavenged goods.
column3: 交易站似乎是旅行者重新补充物资和卖出对阿尼什纳比部落有用的物品的地方。小屋内的货物似乎主要是食品和散装物品。它看起来更像是一个储存区，而不是一个普通的商店。小屋外的商人提供各种商品。很大一部分似乎是用当地材料手工制作的物品，还有一些捡来的货物。

column2: Sit down for a meal.
column3: 坐下来吃顿饭

column2:
You approach the long table, and find an open place on the bench.

The food here is plentiful, and appears to be a mix of roasted and dried meats, roasted corn or maize, baked squash, and beans.

There is also an assortment of berries and other fruit.

Overall, the meal is hearty, with diverse flavors of savory and sweet. It fills your stomach, briefly allowing your mind to wander from minute-to-minute survival.
column3: 你走近长桌，找了个空位坐了下来。这里的食物非常丰富，有烤肉，有干肉，还有烤玉米，焙南瓜果，以及豆子。还有浆果和其他水果搭配着。总的来说，这顿饭真是非常丰盛，色香俱佳五味俱全。你吃得饱饱的，让你在分秒必争的求生之路上得到片刻的休憩。
