column3: 治疗疾病

column2:
There is an indirect science to the medicine, as well. Having observed the animal world's interaction with nature, certain plants and animals have been singled out for their healing properties.

Bear root, boiled in water to extract the medicine, can have restorative effects. Some have even reported illnesses waning under its effects.

Chewing on the root and sipping the tannin tea, your body gains a newfound energy for combating illness.

You thank Joe for his time and his help, then leave the lodge.
column3: 这种治疗方法还有间接的科学之处。人们观察着动物在自然中的行为，找出了有疗效的动植物。野芹根煮在水里释放药性，可以有滋补之用。还有人用它治好了病。嚼了嚼野芹根，呷了呷树茶，你的身体重拾了力量对抗疾病。你对乔道谢，感谢他抽出时间帮助你，然后离开了桑拿草屋。

column2: Leave the village.
column3: 离开村庄

column2:
The enclave has four lightly guarded gates. There isn't much traffic but the four of them are opened all the way. They probably really trust their sentries and patrols.
			
Which gate do you want to exit from?
column3: 飞地有四个守卫森严的大门。虽然来往车辆不多，但四扇大门都是敞开的。他们可能真的很信任自己的哨兵和巡逻队。你想从哪个门出去？

column2: ATN Warrior Conversation (male, brief talk)
column3: ATN战士对话 (男性, brief talk)

column2: He stops a moment, sizing you up. Once satisfied, his attention seems to return to the surroundings.
column3: 他停住打量了你一会。满意后，他的注意力又回到周围。

column2: ATN Warrior Conversation (female, brief talk)
column3: ATN战士对话 (女性, brief talk)

column2:
She raises her hand with a smile. 

"Catch anything good?"

"Boots," you reply.

"Ha ha, lucky!" She waves again as you part ways.
column3: 她笑着举起了手。 "弄到什么好东西了吗?""有鞋子，" 你回应道。"哈哈，挺幸运的嘛!"你们分道扬镳，她向你挥挥手。

column2: Denied Entry - Wanted
column3: 拒绝进入 - 底特律警卫队通缉

column2:
At the front of the line, the guard motions you closer. A moment of pregnant silence precedes a satisfying chirp, and the monitor flashes.

"Visitor Pass N6MAA10816 Suspect Flagged: Detain for Questioning."

Your gut suddenly feels like a vacuum. The guard places a heavy-gloved hand on your shoulder. "Alright, buddy, let's go."

You're led to a gray door at the base of the south buttress, alongside a thin slit of mirrored windows.
column3: 在队伍的前头，警卫示意你靠近。先是片刻的沉默，然后监视器闪烁起来，发出令人满意的响声。"访客通行证 N6MAA10816 嫌疑人标记：拘留审问。"你的内脏突然感觉像真空一样。警卫用重重的手套抓住你的肩膀。"好吧，伙计，走吧。"你被带到南墙根部的一扇灰色门前，门旁有一条狭长的镜面窗户。

column2: Exiled from DMC
column3: 被 DMC 流放

column2:
You're escorted from the interview area, and brought into an on-site clinic, where you're strapped to a table, and anesthetized.

When you wake, you're on a bench in a painted cinder block room, leaning against a corner. Both your head and right shoulder ache. A piercing bleep fills the room as an intercom comes to life.

"You have been charged as follows:
-Assault on a Skycorps agent
-Resisting arrest
-Failure to disclose personal information"
column3: 你被护送出审讯区然后被带到临场诊所，你被绑在桌子上并被麻醉。当你醒来时，你在一个粉刷过的水泥砖房间里的长凳上，就靠在角落里。你的头和右肩都在疼。一种刺耳的哔哔声充斥着房间，对讲机开始讲话了。-袭击 Skycorps 特工 -拒捕行为 -未披露个人信息"

column2: DMC Questioning - Carrying most wanted visitor pass
column3: 底特律问询 - 携带通缉犯的通行证

column2:
By the time your case handler arrives, you've counted the ceiling tiles, grouped them into shades of beige, and created an elaborate conspiracy linking all the missing persons.

Your handler leads you to his cubicle, and you're subjected to a battery of tests, including face scan, retinal scan, DNA sampling, fingerprinting, and a blood sample.

The interview is something of a comedy, with questions like "What is your full name, address, and date of birth?"

The handler isn't amused, however. He then asks about the bracelet and where you found it. You tell him about the strange forest, the creature that lurked in it and the lady. You can't tell if he believes you but his interest in the bracelet is evident.
column3: 当处理你案件的人到达时, 你已经把天花板分成不同米色块并细数过了，又将失踪人员联系起来编成一个阴谋故事。你被处理人带到他的隔间，进行整套录入, 包括面部扫描、视网膜扫描、DNA采样、指纹采样和血样采样。整个面谈有点像某种喜剧，伴随着像是这样的问题："你的全名叫、住哪的、哪天出生？"然而，处理者并不感到高兴。接着他问起手镯的事，问你在哪里找到的。你讲述了那个奇怪的森林、在其中潜伏的生物和那位女士。你无法确定他是否相信你，但他对手环的兴趣显而易见。

column2: Leave.
column3: 离开

column2: You decide not to mess with this place, and duck out of sight.
column3: 你决定不在这个地方惹事，并离开他们的视线。

column2: The small frog - sick
column3: 小青蛙 - 疾病

column2:
You feel wave after wave crash down, turning cotton into rubber over your face. You try not to gag. Struggle as you might, a brook trickles up your nose when you inhale and down your throat when you swallow. You wish death would just take that last step.

When it stops, the taste of filthy water lingers on your tongue. It's all you can do to stop the waters from rising again.
column3: 你感受到一股股水流冲下，将你脸上的棉花浸湿成橡胶一般。你尽量不要插科打诨。你尽力不让自己呕出来。你希望死亡能迈出最后一步。结束的时候，你舌尖还萦绕着那恶心的水味。你唯一能做的就是让自己不把水再吐出来。

column2: The small frog - safe
column3: 小青蛙 - 安全

column2:
You don't count how many times the cultist pours water over your face. You don't count how many gulps of water you swallow just so you can breathe. You don't count the pleas you make, only how many times they're heard.

When the drowning is done, the light in the room has changed. A lantern flickers and you vomit a small puddle onto the decrepit floor.
column3: 你不会数多少次邪教徒往你脸上泼水。你不会数你吞下多少口水只是为了呼吸。淹溺终于结束了，屋里的光也变了。溺水完成后，房间里的光线发生了变化。一盏灯笼闪烁着，你在破旧的地板上吐了一小滩。

column2: Go to the north wing.
column3: 前往北翼

column2:
Blue banners flood the northern hallway more than any other place you've seen in the stronghold, twisting and writhing against each other from gusts of wind that shouldn't be. The smell of stagnant air turns thick. Between the dead yet unbroken fluorescents tracking the ceiling, lanterns lead your eye to a central set of doors.

Cultist engravings run around the doorframe and spill onto the surrounding walls and floor like a fungal growth. It doesn't sound like anyone's inside. You look around before testing the doors.

They're locked.
column3: 蓝色的旗帜在北翼的走廊中比你在堡垒见过的任何地方都要多，在不该出现的阵风的吹拂下，横幅相互扭曲、蠕动。陈腐的空气味道变得浓厚。死气沉沉却未坏的荧光灯在天花板上闪烁，灯笼将你的视线引向中央的一组门。门框上刻有邪教的铭文，蔓延到周围的墙壁和地板上，如同真菌般生长。里面似乎没有人。你环顾四周，然后试着推门。门是锁着的。

column2: Quickly pick the locked door and head inside.
column3: 快速撬开锁上的门，进入里面。

column2:
You wonder why you went through all the trouble of picking the door lock and slipping inside. The room is mostly bereft not only of anything valuable, but even of character. No trophies, no weapons, no history. What few things there are congregate in the far corner, surrounding themselves with emptiness.

There does appear to be a safe, however, flanked by a mattress and a pot.
column3: 你不明白为什么要费尽周折撬开门锁溜进去。房间里不仅没有任何值钱的东西，甚至没有任何特色。没有战利品，没有武器，没有历史。仅有的几样东西都集中在最角落里，周围空荡荡的。不过，房间里确实有一个保险箱，旁边摆放着一张床垫和一个锅。

column2: Scavenge Black Swamp ruins.
column3: 搜刮黑沼泽废墟

column2:
There is little left to explore in this burnt, toxic swamp. This ruin, however, looks like it might have a few caches that escaped complete destruction.

Getting to them, however, is going to be a trick. Rubble threatens to collapse at the slightest touch, and caustic liquid pools here and there.

The good news? You suspect little scavenging competition in this blasted swamp.
column3: 在这片燃烧殆尽的毒沼泽中，几乎没什么可探索的了。然而，这个废墟看起来可能有一些没有被彻底摧毁的藏宝处。然而，要接近它们会很冒险。废墟稍稍一碰可能就会倒塌，而腐蚀性的液体到处都是。好消息呢?你怀疑这该死的沼泽里几乎没有其他拾荒者跟你抢。

column2: Scavenge a forested crash site.
column3: 搜刮杂草重生的坠毁点

column2:
You've stumbled across a crash site.

It looks like a hover truck went down here, crashing through trees and dirt, and scattering it nearby.

There's been a lot of damage in the impact and subsequent fire, but you may find some useful stuff in the wreckage.
column3: 你偶然发现了一个坠毁地点。看起来像是一辆悬浮卡车在这里坠毁，撞开了树木和泥土，并在附近散落。在撞击和随后的火灾中造成了很多损害，但你可以在残骸中找到一些有用的东西。

column2: Scavenge a swamp crash site.
column3: 搜刮沼泽的坠毁点

column2:
You've stumbled across a crash site.

It looks like part of a hover convoy went down here. Vehicle wreckage and containers are spread over the crash site, and peek out of the swamp.

Fire, corrosion, and the crash have taken their toll, but you're betting few scavengers have been through this dismal swamp yet, so the pickings may be good.
column3: 你偶然发现了一个坠毁地点。看起来像是一个悬浮车队的一部分在这里坠毁了。车辆残骸和集装箱分散在坠毁现场，并从沼泽地里探出头来。火灾、腐蚀和坠毁已经造成了影响，但你敢打赌，很少有拾荒者穿过这片荒凉的沼泽地，所以应该能捡到不少好东西。

column2: Outside Saginaw - Wraith
column3: 萨吉诺外-幽灵

column2:
You stop dead in your tracks when a scattering shadow appears before you, resolving its formlessness from thin air, making and unmaking itself along its fringes. Below a pale mask on what looks like its head, a bronze light burns. And there is fury in the light.

With a movement no human body could make, the wraith hurls something at you, then vanishes. You nearly fall back at the force, but manage to stay upright.

You look down. It's a crumpled gas mask with a broken beak.
column3: 当一个散射的影子出现在你面前时，你突然停了下来，凭空化解了它的无形，沿着它的边缘制造和分解自己。在看起来像它头上的苍白面具下面，一盏青铜色的灯在燃烧。光明中有愤怒。用一个人体无法做出的动作，幽灵向你扔了什么东西，然后消失了。你几乎在原力下后退，但设法保持直立。你往下看。这是一个皱巴巴的防毒面具，喙断了。

column2: Go upstairs.
column3: 上楼去。

column2:
Climbing over debris up the stairs, you reach a T intersection, with the living room opening up to your right. There is a musty smell up here, with a faint, sickening sweetness.

Across the living room, you see a hutch surrounded by broken dishes. And atop it, a silver urn.

You cross the moldy room to the hutch, retrieve the urn, and look closely at it. Doesn't seem like much, but to each there is a treasure.
column3: 爬上楼梯的碎片，你到达一个丁字路口，客厅在你的右边。这里有一股霉味，还有一股淡淡的、令人作呕的甜味。穿过客厅，你会看到一个被碎盘子包围的橱柜。在它上面，一个银瓮。你穿过发霉的房间来到橱柜前，取回骨灰盒，仔细观察它。看起来不多，但对每个人来说都有一笔财富。

column2: Found Clearbone Valley
column3: 找到了Clearbone Valley

column2: As you round a corner, you nearly miss it: a reinforced door inset into a brush-covered slope nearby. With the exception of a white button next to the door, there are no other signs of life nearby.
column3: 当你绕过一个拐角时，你几乎错过了它：附近一个灌木丛覆盖的斜坡上有一扇加固的门。除了门旁边的一个白色按钮，附近没有其他生命迹象。

column2: Ask about Elias.
column3: 问问伊莱亚斯。

column2:
"Elias was a bit of a strange man, I admit," Samantha says. "But he was good to us, and he was always so happy to see us. He could only come home once or twice a month, and for no more than a day or two at a time. But when he was here, he was really here, you know? And he never took his work home with him."

She pauses. "Then again, why would he? Being a medicine courier hardly seems that taxing."
column3: “我承认，埃利亚斯是个有点奇怪的人，”萨曼莎说。“但他对我们很好，见到我们总是很高兴。他一个月只能回家一两次，每次不超过一两天。但当他在这里的时候，他真的在这里，你知道吗？而且他从来没有把工作带回家。”她停顿了一下。“话说回来，他为什么要这么做？成为一名药品快递员似乎并没有那么费力。”

column2: Bishop Wraith Appears
column3: 幽灵主教出现

column2:
As the King of the Blue Frog cult lies dead at your feet, a blast of pallid light infests and dries the air with a sudden roar. You feel something coming from behind you. And you turn.

A surge of blackest shadow twists out of itself before you, swelling with such intensity that shards of darkness are shed from its being. A bone-white mask with hollow eyes crowns the being. An eerie yellow light glows beneath it, rumbling with rage.

An instant later, it folds upon itself and disappears.

When you can see your surroundings again, you find the King's body unmoved. A few feet away, a gas mask is torn in half, right down its beak.
column3: 当蓝蛙邪教的国王死在你的脚下时，一阵苍白的光突然咆哮，侵入并干燥了空气。你感觉到有东西从你身后传来。然后你转身。一股最黑的影子在你面前扭曲出来，膨胀得如此强烈，以至于黑暗的碎片从它的存在中脱落。一个带着空洞眼睛的骨白色面具给这个生物加冕。它下面闪烁着诡异的黄光，愤怒地隆隆作响。片刻后，它折叠起来消失了。当你再次看到周围的环境时，你发现国王的尸体一动不动。几英尺外，一个防毒面具被撕成了两半，就在它的喙下面。

column2: Try to broker a deal for the Blue Rot materials.
column3: 试着促成一笔蓝腐材料的交易。

column2:
The junk market might pay a nominal fee for biotech, but this sort of thing goes much further in the right hands.

Fortunately, you know just such a set of hands.

Once the guard has helped you get situated in the elevator, you begin the trundling passage to the upper floors.

Stepping off the lift, Hatter's already eyeing you up, to see what this is all about.
column3: 垃圾市场可能会为生物技术支付象征性的费用，但这种事情在正确的人手中会走得更远。幸运的是，你知道这样一双手。一旦警卫帮助你进入电梯，你就开始滚动通道到上层。走下电梯，哈特已经盯上你了，想看看这是怎么回事。

column2: See if Hatter's available.
column3: 看看哈特是否有空。

column2: Hatter's guard informs you that Hatter's on important business right now, and isn't expected back soon.
column3: 哈特的警卫通知你，哈特现在正在处理重要的事情，预计不会很快回来。

column2: Return to Hatter after being paid for big Blue Rot deal
column3: 在获得big Blue Rot交易报酬后返回哈特

column2:
Hatter's guards treat you differently now. Instead of the stand-offishness of yore, they greet you as if a regular.

"Mr. Kindred," he nods. "We haven't recieved any relevant news for you. Thanks for stopping by, though."
column3: 哈特的警卫现在对你不一样了。他们不再像以前那样冷漠，而是像常客一样问候你。“金德雷德先生，”他点点头。“我们还没有收到你的相关消息。不过，谢谢你过来。”

column2: See if Hatter's available.
column3: 看看哈特是否有空。

column2: Hatter's guard informs you that Hatter's on important business right now, and won't be back until tomorrow.
column3: 哈特的警卫通知你，哈特现在正在处理重要的事情，要到明天才会回来。

column2: Return to the room in the north wing.
column3: 回到北翼的房间

column2:
You wonder why you went through all the trouble of picking the door lock and slipping inside. The room is mostly bereft not only of anything valuable, but even of character. No trophies, no weapons, no history. What few things there are congregate in the far corner, surrounding themselves with emptiness.

There does appear to be a safe, however, flanked by a mattress and a pot.
column3: 你不明白为什么要费尽周折撬开门锁溜进去。房间里不仅没有任何值钱的东西，甚至没有任何特色。没有战利品，没有武器，没有历史。仅有的几样东西都集中在最角落里，周围空荡荡的。不过，房间里确实有一个保险箱，旁边摆放着一张床垫和一个锅。

column2: Head for the bathroom.
column3: 去卫生间

column2:
It first seemed that the communal bathroom's lights had been turned off, but as you approach, you see a flickering outline along the inner fringes of the doorframe.

You stand in front of it, listening to the quiet click-click-click of the light- a testament to how quiet it is in here despite the space's potential for echoing.

You can't explain it, but you shiver when you reach for the door.

It's locked.
column3: 起初你以为公共浴室的灯光已经熄灭，但当你靠近时，你看到门框内侧的轮廓在微弱地闪烁。你站在门前，听着灯光发出的轻微的“咔嗒咔嗒”声——这说明这里虽然空间可能会产生回声，但实际上非常安静。你无法解释，但当你伸手去触摸门把手时，你感到一阵寒意。门是锁着的。

column2: I want to burn Grayling down.
column3: 我想把格雷林一把火烧了

column2:
The woman holds still. "You're lying," she says, her voice steadier than the mist.

"No," you plead. "This base has to be destroyed. I have committed to that, and it is the only reason I've come here, dangerous as it is."

She eases forward, never pointing her gun away. You stand still.

When she's close enough that you can see the hazel of her eyes surrounded by blue and green dazzle facepaint, she asks: "Are you really telling the truth?"

You nod.

She all but drops her gun. "Oh, thank god."
column3: 那女人一动也不动。"你撒谎，" 她的声音比雾气还绵稠。"不，" 你辩解道。“这个基地必须被摧毁。"我一定会摧毁这个基地，我保证过，而且那就是我来这的唯一理由，尽管危险重重。"她稍微放松了一些，但并没有把枪口挪开，你只好站在原地。你站着别动。她接近到足够让你看清她那被蓝色和橙色的扎眼的面部彩绘时，她问道:"你说的是真话吗?"你点点头。她放下枪整个人都放松下来。"哦，感谢上帝。"

column2: Martha's Army Soldier Conversation (male)
column3: 玛莎军团士兵对话 (男性)

column2: As you approach, you can't help staring at his face paint. It looks like someone tested an entire shape stencil sheet on his face.
column3: 当你走近时，你忍不住盯着他脸上的油漆。看起来就像有人在他的脸上测试了一整张形状模版。

column2: Martha's Army Soldier Conversation 2 (male)
column3: 玛莎军团士兵对话 2 (男性)

column2:
"You carryin'?" he asks, stopping a short distance away.

You look at him, confused.

"Tracking devices," he exhales. "Bugs. Hardware. Got anything switched on?"
column3: "你带着?"他问道，和你保持了一些距离。你看着他，有点迷惑。“虫子。硬件。"窃听器，其他硬件，你身上有东西开着吗？"

column2: Martha's Army JD (Male, no talk)
column3: 玛莎军团 JD (男性, 无对话)

column2: "We move without *them* watching," he nods upward. He doesn't stop to talk.
column3: "我们的行动*他们*无法监视，" 他向上点点头，没有停止说话。她喋喋不休道。

column2: Martha's Army JD (male, done talking)
column3: 玛莎军团 JD (男性, 结束谈话)

column2:
"Privacy is our greatest asset," he recites as he passes by you.

"Anonymity is our greatest weapon."
column3: "隐私是我们最宝贵的财富，" 他走过你身边时这样吟诵着。"匿名是我们最强大的武器。"

column2: Climb out window cont'd.
column3: 爬出窗外续

column2:
You're in the parking lot of Gyges Cryo Facility, but everything looks disused and in disrepair. Plants have pushed their way through the pavement and over the facility.

Worst of all, nothing looks familiar. You don't remember this place, or even who you are. Your frustration mounts, but you catch it and put it in check. Might as well take a look around.
column3: 你在吉格斯冷冻设施的停车场，但一切看起来都是废弃的，年久失修。植物已经从人行道上长了出去，并且也覆盖住了设施。最糟糕的是，没有任何东西看起来很熟悉。你不记得这个地方，甚至不记得你是谁。你的挫折感越来越强，但你将其控制住了。或许可以四处看看。

column2: Jump out window cont'd.
column3: 爬出窗外续

column2:
The distant report of a gun disrupts your thoughts. You cock your head, listening, but it's over as quickly as it started.

Obviously you're not alone out here. Though that doesn't necessarily comfort you.

You snap out of it. "First things first," you tell yourself. "Let's make sure we've lost that...thing."
column3: 远处的枪声打断了你的思路。你歪着头听着，但很快就结束了。显然，你在这里不是一个人。虽然这不一定能让你感到安慰。你振作起来。"第一件事，" 你告诉自己。"让我们确定我们已经失去了那个...东西。"

column2: Martha's Army Soldier Conversation (female)
column3: 玛莎军团士兵对话 (女性)

column2:
"These are dark times," she greets you.

You nod. "You could say that."

"Though," she adds, seizing upon your willingness to talk, "sometimes darkness can be on our side."
column3: "这真是个黑暗的时代，" 她向你打招呼。 你点点头。"你可以这么说。""但是，" 趁着你愿意说话，她又说道。 "有时黑暗是和我们站在一边的。"

column2: Martha's Army Soldier Conversation 2 (female)
column3: 玛莎军团士兵对话 2 (女性)

column2: "You'll have to excuse our manners," she concedes. "Us conspiracy-types tend to wax poetic. Comes with the territory."
column3: "你得原谅我们的行事方法，" 她让步了。"涉及到领土问题时，我们这种智谋型的角色更倾向于做些漂亮文章。"伴随着领土而来。”

column2: Martha's Army Recruiter (female, no talk)
column3: 玛莎军团招募人员 (女性, 无对话)

column2:
"Where there is security," she opines, "there is no liberty."

She doesn't stop to talk.
column3: "有安全的地方，" 她说道， "就没有自由。"她喋喋不休道。

column2: Martha's Army Recruiter (female, done talking)
column3: 玛莎军团招募人员 (女性, 结束谈话)

column2:
"Privacy is our greatest asset," she recites as she passes by you.

"Anonymity is our greatest weapon!"
column3: "隐私是我们最宝贵的财富，" 她从你身边经过时念叨着。"匿名是我们最强大的武器！"

column2: Returning to Hatter for business
column3: 回到哈特做生意

column2: You cross the muddy street towards the old flophouse.
column3: 你穿过泥泞的街道，走向旧的廉价旅馆。

column2: See if Hatter has any work for you.
column3: 看看哈特有没有工作给你。

column2:
You step off the familiar lift, and Hatter turns to look at you, finishing his conversation.

"Private call with a client, boys," Hatter says to his hired guns. "Don't worry if this one kills me; your pensions are nil either way."

He circles behind his desk. And when the guards shut the doors behind them, he says, "We have to talk."
column3: 你走下熟悉的电梯，哈特转身看着你，结束了他的谈话。“和客户的私人电话，伙计们，”哈特对他雇佣的枪手说。“如果这家伙杀了我也不用担心，反正你的退休金都是零。”他在桌子后面转圈。当警卫把门关上时，他说：“我们得谈谈。”

column2: See if Hatter's available.
column3: 看看哈特是否有空。

column2: Hatter's guard informs you that Hatter's on important business right now, and isn't expected back soon.
column3: 哈特的警卫通知你，哈特现在正在处理重要的事情，预计不会很快回来。

column2: Michigan Roadmap
column3: 密歇根州路线图

column2:
Once cheap and ubiquitous at roadside stops, these pocket roadmaps have become something of an archeological tool for modern scavengers.

You carefully unfold the giant leaf, and try to make sense of where you are.
column3: 这些便宜的小型公路地图曾经在路边站点广泛使用，现在已经成为现代拾荒者的考古工具。你仔细展开巨大的地图，试图弄清楚你在哪里。

column2: "Last Chance" Canteen
column3: "最后的机会" 餐厅

column2:
You're standing outside the "Last Chance" Canteen.

Originally named for its location on the outskirts of the Sprawl, locals often joke that the "Last Chance" Canteen is, in fact, a warning to prospective patrons. 

Known for serving whatever is "available", as well as a few suspect staple dishes, the "Last Chance" is a venue for those hungry and not too fussy about their food's origins.

Still, the old fifth-wheel draws lines enough to keep its grills hot, so nobody must've died from their food.

Yet.
column3: 你站在 "最后的机会" 餐厅外面。最初因为位于城市边缘而得名，本地人常常开玩笑说， "最后的机会"餐厅实际上是对潜在顾客的警告。餐厅以提供 "有什么吃什么"的食物以及一些可疑的主食而闻名，"最后的机会" 是为那些饥肠辘辘、对食物来源不太挑剔的人提供的场所。尽管如此，这辆老式五轮车依然吸引了足够的排队人数来保持烤架的热度，所以没人因为食物而死去过。至少还没有。

column2: Sweet and sour seagull wings - $6
column3: 糖醋海鸥翅 - $6

column2:
"Didja know seagull's a land bird?" the cook shouts over the fans and sizzling. "Easy to catch, too!" he guffaws. 

"Yeah, and easy to overcook," you add, under your breath.
column3: 海鸥其实是陆地鸟类！" 厨子的声音越过嗤嗤冒油的厨台和风扇旁朝你吼道。"这些东西其实好抓得很！" 他大笑着。"对，要把它们烤糊也容易得很。" 你小声附和着。

column2: Tenders - $4
column3: 炸肉 - $4

column2: What you get isn't far from what you imagined: smallish; amorphous; fried; tender.
column3: 你拿到手的那份倒和你想象的没差多远：量不大，乱兮兮，油腻腻，软塌塌。

column2: Non-veg stew - $8
column3: 非素食炖菜 - $8

column2:
Despite your inquiries, you fail to learn anything more about the non-committal stew. 

The flavor is just as perplexing as the name. Better than dirty socks boiled in MSG, but only just. Still, it's a very filling meal.
column3: 尽管你进行了询问，但你没能了解到更多关于这道名不见经传的炖菜的信息。味道和名字一样令人费解。味道就像名字一样令人费解。比用味精煮的脏袜子好，但只是好而已。

column2: Mixed veggie bowl with protein "crispies" - $7
column3: 含蛋白质的 "脆皮" 蔬菜杂烩 - $7

column2:
Feeling more adventurous, you opt for the extra protein sprinkled over the mixed veggie bowl. 

While the blackened, cornflake-like objects don't address the lack of flavor in the original dish, you can't argue that it doesn't change the texture.
column3: 怀着大无畏的精神，你选择在混合蔬菜碗上撒上额外的蛋白质。虽然变黑的玉米片状物体并不能解决原始菜肴中缺乏风味的问题，但你不能说它没有改变口感。

column2: Mixed veggie bowl - $5
column3: 蔬菜杂烩 - $5

column2:
Being the safest dish on the menu, it's arguably the most popular. Not for lack of trying, though. 

A mix of sprouts and shredded carrots, lettuce, and turnips fried in oil, if it had a flavor, you'd describe it as savory with a sweet-yet-pungent aftertaste. 

If it had a flavor.
column3: 作为菜单上最安全的菜肴，它可以说是最受欢迎的，这可不是因为人们只敢点它。不过，并不是因为缺乏尝试。豆芽和胡萝卜丝、生菜和油炸萝卜的混合物，如果它有味道，你会形容它是咸的，回味甜而辛辣。如果它有味道的话。

column2: Buy bottled water - $18
column3: 购买瓶装水 - $18

column2: The food may be sketchy, but at least the bottled water is legit.
column3: 食物可能有些不靠谱，但至少瓶装水是真的。

column2: St. James Parkade
column3: 圣詹姆斯停车场

column2:
St. James Parkade is what it sounds like: a pre-apocalypse parking garage. Except in this case, repurposed to berth humans. Someone had the bright idea to leave all the cars in a parking garage, hook them up to an unlicensed power tap, and charge occupancy by the night. 

A patron could rent an open pickup if they're down on their luck (and own a sleeping bag). They could rent a hatchback if they have a little extra to spend on heat and shelter (and door locks). Or, if they have the taste for finer living, splurge for a full-size van with its own chem-toilet.

The rent also includes access to your very own storage space. There's a keypad on each door, so the storage rooms are protected by electronic locks. Fancy.

It's no Ritz Carlton. However, it's also not sleeping exposed to anyone who wanders by. And that's what counts.
column3: 圣詹姆斯停车场，顾名思义：一个世界末日前的停车场。只是在这种情况下，它被重新利用来出租。有人想出了一个绝妙的主意，将所有汽车都留在停车场，将它们连接到未经许可的电网上，并按夜间收费。如果一个顾客资金不足（并拥有一个睡袋），他们可以租一辆敞篷皮卡。如果他们有一点额外的钱可以花在供暖和住所（以及门锁）上，他们可以租一辆掀背车。或者，如果他们喜欢更好的生活，可以挥霍租赁一辆带有化学马桶的全尺寸货车。租金还包括使用你自己的存储空间。 每扇门上都有一个键盘，所以储藏室有电子锁保护， 讲究。时髦的。这不是丽思卡尔顿酒店。然而，它也不会暴露在任何路过的人面前。这才是最重要的。

column2: Rent a pickup for 24 hours - $20
column3: 租用24小时的皮卡 - $20

column2:
When you find your stall, there's a maroon pickup truck in it. The bed's more than big enough to stretch out, maybe for two or three people if you really wanted.

The cab, on the other hand, is pretty minimal. No sleeping in there, unless you're a fan of sore neck and back. 

It'll do for a place to safely stash your stuff, though. And the parkade's roof at least stops the rain.
column3: 当你找到你的停车位时，里面有一辆深红色的皮卡车。车床足够大，如果你真的想要的话，也许可以容纳两到三个人。另一方面，里面的驾驶室相当小。你不能在那里睡觉，除非你喜欢给你的颈部和背部带来酸痛。不过，它足以安全地存放你的东西。而停车场的屋顶至少可以挡雨。

column2: Rent a hatchback for 24 hours - $45
column3: 租用24小时的掀背车 - $45

column2:
You find your assigned stall, and there's an emerald-colored hatchback there, covered in dust.

Inside, some of the seats have been removed, but the rear bed offers just enough room to stretch out. 

There are no amenities inside. No blankets, TV, or running water. However, the old electric engine's been wired to the grid, so you have ample climate control and light. Combined with door locks and windows, this beats most beds you've made while in the wild.
column3: 你找到了你分配的停车位，有一辆满是灰尘的翠绿色掀背车。里面的一些座位已经被拆掉了，后面的床有足够的空间可以伸展。里面没有任何便利设施。没有毛毯、电视或自来水。然而，老旧的电动引擎已经接入电网，所以你可以在里面控制温度和光线。加上门锁和窗户，这比你在野外的大多数床都要好。

column2: Rent a full-size van for 24 hours - $120
column3: 租用24小时的全尺寸货车 - $120

column2:
When you arrive at your stall, you find a large, gray conversion van parked there. 

With an extended roof, built-in porta-potty, and comfortable appointments, this is as top-of-the-line as you're gonna get in this place.

You toss your things inside, lock the doors behind you, and draw the curtains. With the heat just right, and the lights dimmed, you stretch out in your temporary mansion.
column3: 当你到达你的停车位时，你发现一辆大型的灰色改装货车停在那里。这辆车有一个加长的车顶，内置厕所，还有舒适的设施，这是你在这个地方能得到的最好的东西。你把你的东西扔进去，锁上了你身后的门，拉上窗帘。暖气恰到好处，灯光暗淡，你在你的临时宫殿里伸展着身体。

column2: Parkade Rental Expired
column3: 停车场营地租赁到期

column2:
You're alerted to the sound of a cart approaching. A guy in a hoodie pushes his cart to a nearby car, checks for occupants, and unlocks it. He makes quick work of taking anything of value left in the car, and throws trash into a big bin.

Then, he starts wheeling towards you. "Time's up, buddy."

Better get your stuff together and go, lest any of it end up on that cart.
column3: 一辆手推车驶来的声音提醒了你。一个穿连帽衫的人把他的手推车推到附近的一辆汽车上，检查是否有人，然后打开车锁。他迅速拿走了留在车上的任何有价值的东西，并将垃圾扔进一个大垃圾桶。然后，他推着车朝你走去。"时间到了，伙计。"你最好把你的东西整理好，不然它们有可能会被放到那辆手推车里。

column2: Store policies
column3: 商店政策

column2:
Hardware/Software:
If hardware/software is not switched on and unlocked, vendors will only pay the hardware's value as if it were empty. Items will then be appraised by a specialist, and resold at full price.

Items in Containers:
If you can't afford the items inside a container, you are not allowed to pick the container up. Also, you can only empty out items you can afford from the containers.

Unidentified Items:
Vendors will only pay a nominal fee for unidentified items. The items will then be identified and sold at full price.

When in doubt, verify the vendor's purchase price before surrendering items to them. All sales final!
column3: 硬件/软件：如果硬件/软件没有打开和解锁，供应商只会支付硬件的价值，就好像它是空的一样。然后，物品将由专家进行评估，并按全价转售。容器中的物品：如果你买不起容器内的物品，则不允许拿起容器。此外，你只能从容器中清空你负担得起的物品。不明物品：卖家只需为不明物品支付象征性的费用。然后，这些物品将被识别并以全价出售。如果有疑问，在把物品交给小贩之前，先核实他们的购买价格。一律概不退换!
